2icZnNf032BufSb4TDCCZw.text: Went for lunch and just got the salad bar. Everything was fresh and really good. I will definitely go back for dinner for the full experience. Server was great.

QCafKMMfroaBwrf5CvU4bA.text: NEXT LEVEL!!!!! Very dear friend of ours took my wife and I out to celebrate my retirement. This place was unbelievable, salad bar was loaded with all my favorites! However, whoever came up the waiters bringing endless steak, chicken, lamb and pork should be our next president!!! Oh yeah, I almost forgot my huge slice of cheesecake topped with strawberries! I didn't need it but I ate it anyway!

Jtz-cQ5OH6pH8u4Vz0dlbw.text: Me and my husband went there on sat for our Anniversary the service was great people were friendly and the food was so good the manager was great we had a wonderful time we will see you soon also we will tell our friends and family

AesZcqe88VV1D0ka003yhw.text: Amazing experience, great food, thanks to Erick to make our experience memorable. Was there with a few friends visiting, I'll def will be back.

gEH-QNTRrQD3MHYyhPeXyA.text: I went here because I love love Fogo de Chao. I have been several times to the one in Miami and I love it. I came here for lunch and left with a check of around 50 usd which is ok. The staff is friendly and correct. In particular my waiter was. He was Eastern European and I forgot his name but super friendly. The place is just depressing, at least during lunch when I was there. There were maybe a 2-3 other tables taken, the vegetable buffet looked just sad and gray and the meat that was coming out was really minimum which I understand you do as a business when there are no clients. Overall I only liked the filet mignon., everything was over cooked. This place needs more customers so it can survive. It has great potential but it's just strange to sit alone in a huge restaurant and getting much less variety of meat as they have in other places who are busy.

hqXefHA9wvc5RBe05_nQMA.text: My go to Brazilian restaurant! I was recently there with my girl friends for a birthday celebration and the food was amazing not to mention the service, The manager Erick was extremely kind and helpful in helping choose our drinks. Definitely a wonderful experience, If you're looking for great food and exceptional service, this is the place!

e9bM_y1ONO2QORlT5x2t0Q.text: Went for a visit to see my dad for his birthday, great restaurant for celebrating special events. The manager, Erick was so helpful and was always making sure everything was ok at our table. The food was amazing as always as was the service, definitely recommending this restaurant to friends and family.

zSzHpE4WVYaCquYmu001cw.text: Unfortunately, this was not the rating I was expecting to use prior to visiting Fogo. Service wasn't the best.  A few friends ordered a pineapple mint lemonade which I was told tasted like straight pineapple juice and they ran out of mint. We had to ask for more plantains/bread/potatoes. Meat stopped coming around after about 30 mins. That was about 9pm and they don't close until 10 so I don't know why they stopped...we had to ask to have more brought around. The salad bar is really disappointing. Interior is nice and more upscale than other Brazilian steakhouses I've been to. And finally, after being instructed to park in their Oliver garage since they validate parking we were told they ran out of tickets. Overall was it was a bit of a flop, womp womp

47jrhJyPftgzh9iBEX4chQ.text: We have visited this restaurant several times since it opened last year and we keep coming back.  The manager and his very accommodating staff make every effort to insure you have a good time.  They do change up the menu with seasonal dishes to mix things up for repeat customers.  The carrot ginger soup and pork belly and pineapple were delicious  additions for summer.  The staff is amazing.  As other reviewers have said, if there is a certain meat you want to try they will make sure to get it to your table as soon as possible.  Can't decide between two bottles of wine?  Let's get you two samples to try before you select.  Of course this is probably limited to wines they sell by the glass.  $49.99 for the Total Experience is a fair price for all that is included.  With access to the wonderful market table, meat selection, and sides brought to your table, it is a great value.  Of course, there are more economical choices if you are not a big eater.  Fogo is a great place to visit in a small or large group.  Go hungry, take your time and enjoy a great meal.

TXhvFbRgEtW3xpOJcC14JA.text: I made a reservation over a week in advance because we were going for a special occasion, and upon arrive, shortly before the reservation time we were told there was going to be a significant wait and that they did not know when we could be seated. We ended up being seated 30-40min after our reservation. I understand that tables sometimes just sit around but, 30-40 is way too long to keep a reservation waiting.   During the wait we headed to the bar, and were told we couldn't stand in the only space we could find, and the bar tender did not offer to get us drinks at that point. We moved to another area, and waiting at least ten minutes to be served. The bar was not overly busy for the three bartenders that were working. We finally got our drinks about 5 minutes before being sat.   Once sat, our waiter was a little rude because we were confused about the different price options, he was hard to hear. I had only been to Brazilian steakhouses where you pay one price for everything, rather than different levels of options. And then when we selected the most expensive options (we wanted to try it all and were celebrating) he tried to talk us out of it because it did not include desert. I told him no thank you, we had desert waiting at home.   The food was good but the salad bar was severely under stocked for a busy night. Many of the cheese and salad options were just empty platters and I didn't see most of them restocked before we left.   All in all, this dinner was very disappointing. The men serving the food were wonderful and polite, however the waiters and bartenders were rude and inattentive. Although the salad bar was under stocked, I must say the meat selection tasted great. Although the food itself was good, we will not be returning based off of the service we received.

9dtBDDOfQ_QdCz96QmHXgw.text: This has become my favorite Stakehouse in town. Everything from the food quality to the service level is impecable in this place. Their personal is very aware of knowing what are your preferences in meat cuts, and cook point, and they remember. I only had to say it once my first time in there, after that I go every other week if I can and they remember my name, what meat cut I like and how cooked I want it. The servers are extremely friendly, and culturally diverse which for me is a + Plus! Fogo de Chao and their team have brought to Downtown Pittsburgh the amazing service and food quality we've all been waiting for!

35SSUXcYMYXiursbmyue4Q.text: You had me at Giant Bowl of Bacon! Everything here was so great. I thought because it was a chain it would be sub-par, but I was wrong. And the service - wonderful. Will be back. If you are thinking of going, just do it - you won't regret it. Oh and the cocktails are awesome too! Had to Guava and also the Cucumber and mint.

1-GZCk_gv9ZKOQlVnasUxg.text: Our first experience at Fogo de Chao Brazilian was great due to our awesome server Austin.

Nq2snLRkEh7RXP4Fvd7mAg.text: I have gone to Fogo twice for happy hour.  Both times have been awful.  They somehow managed to get worse with age.  The folks at the bar were inattentive and there were not enough bartenders on either occasion for a Friday happy hour.  The only reason I'm giving two stars is because Fogo has a happy hour menu.  Many downtown restaurants don't.

ucRV_LdduFJWJ55ngf2S8Q.text: What a wonderful addition to downtown Pittsburgh's food scene. We went last night with a group of 6 people. Even though they have only been open a short while, the food & service were both excellent! Everything we tried was delicious. The salad/charcuterie bar was amazing (don't forget to try the maple bacon-we almost cleaned them out of that!).  The atmosphere itself is lovely. Spacious and yet warm & inviting at the same time. They have a beautiful wine vault / wall that makes you really thirsty. We all agreed to a return visit in the near future!

gLvIVov5Ftplj0Ndb6LpPA.text: Wasn't impressed. I've been to fogos in other cities where the salad bar was much more impressive and the service was better. The meats were very good and circulating nicely, however I wasn't overly impressed with the service. We Sat for what felt like an eternity waiting for our check- would have been nice to be offered more drinks from the bar as well. Did not see the value for the money here- I would recommend going to Texas De Brazil or even the Green Forest in Penn Hills first...both were better in my eyes.

h2l_yoMLbxdldAf2x11IlA.text: service slow, they don't refill ur drink until u finish it (server said when i asked for more pepsi) ! Lamb chops & lamb are marinated with lemon and pepper which is too much. I couldnt eat it. Steaks are okay, manager was nice, parking free, authentic and fancy place

PUvkDMrhnuyXH0A94mJi5A.text: Restaurant exceeded expectations and hands down is better than the food, options, and service I've received at other Brazilian steakhouse locations in Pittsburgh.  In talking with my server I found that they have 17 different cuts of USDA choice chicken, lamb, pork and beef that is shipped in consistently, never frozen. The market table is huge with a variety of veggies, fruits, rice, beans, meats & cheeses, smoked salmon, etc. I was shocked to find the location is not only healthy but 99% gluten free.  The service and food were beyond impressive, I had no wait and was greeted with lots of smiles (we know that's not always common in Pittsburgh). If asked if you want to try a cocktail, you must! Best drinks I've had in awhile, the Brazilian caiperina was so tasty.  I will be bringing my very large family next time. It looked like they have multiple private & semi-private spaces to book that would be nice for a large group.

2WgfmbjIUyXZzWzZr5YGBw.text: I came here with my wife for the Yelp event. I was more then impressed by how they handled the large group of people. Food and drinks were delivered more then timely and all the servers were very pleasant and attentive to our needs.  We started out with the Market Table buffet which has possibly the widest selection of food I have seen. The freshness and quality of all the items was impeccable. When it was time for the servers to arrive with the meat skewers to pick from, I could hardly keep up as there was such a large variety to pick from. As a meat lover I was in my element and tried pretty much every single one of them. The quality was outstanding. I have been to a few other Brazilian Steakhouses before, but Fogo de Chao in PGH easily beats them all.  The dessert they provided was again excellent and even though full form the dinner I could not resist and was glad I didn't . We will most definitely return here in the future and will recommend this restaurant to all my friends and acquaintances.

awI3IYpwKWEh43zo137-lA.text: Pittsburgh Restaurant Week: Disaster is putting it lightly. Came early to the bar and they were not equipped to make drinks. Bartenders were frantic and grabbing things from various areas. It took over 20 minutes to order a drink. This is before we even sat down. Having a reservation, we checked in beforehand and then again at 6:30, our reservation time. They definitely were overwhelmed so I was being patient. We sat down closer to 6:55 and explained the restaurant deal...basically saved you $4 and got lousy dessert. The PRW special included the Brazilian cuts, not the Full Churrasco Experience (which was $49 regular price)   Again, we waited a very long time for the wait team (more on that later) to take or drink order before going to the market table/buffet. And again longer for our wines to come. The buffet was actually good. Full of cured meats, cheeses, salads, fruits, veggies, soup and bread.  The meats were slow to start once we turned out cards to green, but once they did, they all were pretty good. The servers always were nice, asked how we wanted the cut prepared and the meats were all hot and delicious. I do want to note that we were not offered a clean dinner plate and instead were forced to use the dirty buffet plate...I went up to grab a few clean ones from the buffet table.  Dessert options included a chocolate mousse, key lime or lemon pie and maybe one other choice. The chocolate mousse was in fact dry chocolate cake.   The wait staff seemed very overwhelmed. Our main waiter never came over to ask if we wanted a specific meat server to come over. No clean plates. Just wanted ya in and out. In addition, it seemed like it was a team atmosphere. One server introduced themselves and brought water. Another took our drink orders and brought the wine. Another brought dessert and tried to give us checks, only until the first server came back to ask about checks and then eventually got them.   Overall, Green Forest offers the same (maybe even better) meats but also more options and the wait staff is far superior. I even remember Texas de Brazil to be better. The food is decently tasty but the service was not good. I would pass on this and choose another one of the Pittsburgh Brazilian steakhouses.

x03fY8uzhMMb7_p4chHKBg.text: Sat by the bar area. Bartender Ryan was great. Caparinhas were amazing.  So was the picanha burger.  Great place for happy hour and an all around awesome experience.

qd6k8iQMWZ0sLRzDkCoVsg.text: Wonderful place not as fancy as I thought, many mixed dress from shorts to a person in a sequin dress and many in between so do not be deterred from eating here because you thought it was too formal.  Bright, cheerful and roomy restaurant. Staff was attentive, friendly and easy to find. Some staff were difficult to understand due to heavy accents but frankly pretty easy to get the just of what you need to do to 'get your meats'.  Don't do as we first did and used our 'yes/no' circular cards as coasters. Ha.   The food was wonderful, plentiful and diverse.  Would return next time in area.

HPspjU5_NWwIJm4KaJ5WFQ.text: Excellent all around! Last minute sitter and they were able to accommodate an impromptu reservation. The service and food was superb. The meat options/rotations were right on. All of the staff were friendly and attentive. Definitely going to bring the kids next time. We loved Pittsburgh Fogo de Chao!!!!

h4wdlGmqNfETygxn7zS-lA.text: No worries about walking out full and sick of meat at this joint.  $35 to be ignored, finally remembered and served everything well done.  They never even asked how I liked my food so I guess it's not hard to understand why I didn't get it medium rare.  This place sucks and I'll never be back

ySGSowsxpFnQPRJj2Tetrg.text: My boyfriend and I decided to come here to celebrate my birthday. We both chose the full experience from the menu.  Our expectations were very high, as been having a fabulous previous experience at Texas de Brazil.   The service was great. Everyone was extremely nice and professional, and I never had a glass of water below the halfway mark. The meat that came around was good. Our favorite was the house special, however it was very salty. I did notice that after the first few rounds the meats were just repeating, so in my opinion the selection of meat wasn't as broad as I had expected. The market table (or unlimited buffet where you get most of your side dishes) was good. I don't think it was as extensive as Texas de Brazil. There are mostly cold things (veggies, meats, cheeses, potato salad), but there are some warm dishes such as rice and beans. The servers bring mashed potatoes and plantains to your table.   Overall, I must say everything was delicious. A first timer would definitely be awe'd. If you're looking to compare to other similar restaurants, you might be slightly disappointed.

-4XOJwTkZSWv4enObC2ISw.text: So, this review is very disappointing to me, but I have to write it. Last year, I attended a Yelp Elite event here and it was amazing! The food was great, drinks were delicious, and service was amazing! I was telling my fiance how great of an experience it was and he said he wanted to check it out. Fast forward to New Year's day. We made a reservation and when we got there, we were seated right away. A waitress came over and explained the experience and took our drink orders. We went to the salad bar and got some items- everything was stocked, however there was an employee who paced back and forth by the plates, so much so, that we actually almost bumped into each other while I was getting a plate. The whole evening she just stood at the salad bar. Not the best use of an employee, but this isn't my restaurant, so okay.  Another waiter brought over the Brazilian cheese bread and yet another waitress brought our drinks back. Once we turned our cards over to green, the men carrying the meats came over (frequently!) and offered different cuts of meat. Throughout our time here, different waitstaff came over to check on us. Our original waitress never came back over, so my fiance mentioned that they all must be working together as one team that shares the tips at the end of the night.  I would also like to add that other than the cheese bread, we did not receive any of the other sides that I was able to try at the Yelp Event... like the Yuka fries, bananas, and those delicious mashed potatoes.  So our bill comes out and we use the gift card we received from the Yelp Event, and then my fiance put the rest on his card. Once our bill came back, my fiance signed with the lower amount and we left a cash tip. He wrote 'cash tip' on the merchant copy and he accidentally left the customer copy on the table.  Fast forward to a few days later and he notices that his card was charged a completely different amount from what the original bill was and the bill after the gift card... he was billed $21 more than the lower amount. I called to inquire what happened and someone took my information and said a manager would call me back later that day. I didn't receive a call that day, so I called back the next day and asked to speak directly to a manager. I spoke with a manager and after about an hour, he figured out that a $21 tip was added onto the 'customer copy.' I informed him that we wrote cash tip on the merchant copy (and he acknowledged that he has that copy too) so I asked how $21 got written in, when we left it blank. He said that our check number looked like another one that night... and to be honest, I wasn't listening to the rest of the explanation because all I could think about was... is it customary for the employees to write in their own tip amounts on peoples' checks!? The manager said he would put the $21 back into my fiance's account and send us a gift card. But, that whole experience left such a sour taste in my mouth. I was very disappointed by the whole experience. I did give fogo one star because the food I tried was all pretty good.

ga4bo8Zgdj5njIgnlyzcjw.text: I have been to this place many times but never have i had such good service especially Evan he kept checking on us to see if we needed anything else and another guy Neko was fantastic they treated us with so much respect I loved them they were both fantastic and they made me feel like a little princess I loved it I hope I see Evan and Neko again and I hope both of them get promotions

1ioWt3MhEqepFaPpvkpVhw.text: Seriously none of us had any room for dessert but as you see we all got dessert it was delicious. This was our very first time at this restaurant and we were all thrilled. The staff right from when you walk in the door until you leave again are top notch. They are all attentive to whatever you need. The food was amazing we tried everyone of the meats and oh my can I tell you the mashed potatoes at the table, Pure comfort food Yum. The salad bar was wonderful. You definitely need to do the full Churrasco Experience. We All Loved It !!

5z1zOc3PBWQ7ZuVzdMGjZw.text: The meat is perfectly seasoned and the meat is perfectly cooked.  The Parmesan pork chops are so tender and juicy and the flavor.  The lamb chops were good but the lamb steaks were the second best item after those amazing pork chops.  The sausage was delicious and all the steaks were great.  Ate way too much because everything was cooked perfectly and tasted so good.  Bacon wrapped chicken, chicken legs the flavor profiles are the best.  All you can eat for $48 dollars you just can't beat it.  The staff is friendly and explain the seasoning and can always find a rare or medium cut for you.

aMCBD-7uHgC_5mUHt6DeYg.text: New hot Brazilian (steakhouse) in town. Chic, hip decor, good wine, and BBQ in the vein of the gaucho style all you can eat meateries. For the non meat lovers, they offer a popular Chilean sea bass or salmon option and a market table of fresh veggies, soups, cheeses, meats and smoked salmon that is worthy of a trip alone.   I think once you go once and eat everything and figure out your favorite meat to eat, the best value would be the Gaucho lunch with Meat selection or the Select Cuts for dinner. Both include the Market table. Parking is super convenient(the parking elevator literally lets you out right by the back entrance) and is free after four with validation during the week.   The restaurant felt a little too cool for me to break out my trusty iPhone to take some snaps, but I wanted to take some pictures of their beautiful market table. It is chock full of deliciousness.   It is not cheap and I can't imagine anyone eating there for lunch or dinner for less than $25-$75, esp. with a nice glass of wine (or two), but located in the old Sak's department store, it is a neat trip to see how well they repurposed the space.

Z-EBeoSDci0ehxrsOQQ0wQ.text: We went to dinner for the first time here before the Rod Stewart concert. The place is very nice and has been nicely decorated. Staff is very friendly. Very nice selection on the salad bar and very good. All the meats were delicious lots of flavor. We will be back for another visit!

J_UxFSXmyxpGJoBar1kT0w.text: First time at this restaurant. We showed up just before 2:00 on a Saturday, and the hostess and server debated if we should get the brunch or dinner. Tip; It turns out that the only difference is the price, so we were happy to take the brunch pricing! Everyone was extremely friendly. Food was excellent. It was cool that every worker and manager that was passed as we left thanked us for coming.  Recommended!

a1fcroQpBxZMlFQd2wJiQg.text: Dinner was amazing. This was my first time to a steakhouse like this.  It was really great service, everyone work together to help out. Just a smooth flow of how it worked to ensure a great experience. So this was my first time here so got the full experience dinner, forgot the name of it, but a great selection of options. Readily available.    Desert was; well just look at the pics.

BU9ok-pqcn8nwS3C76eKfg.text: I have dined a number of times at Fogo de Chao in King of Prussia, Pennsylvania, and have enjoyed it.  This was my first time at the Pittsburgh location, on a Sunday night, toward the end of the evening.  The atmosphere is far better than the crowded, uncomfortable, loud, and cramped Pittsburgh Texas de Brazil, and there are more and better options at the salad station.  I love that some of my favorites are available: roasted cauliflower, marinated mushrooms, asparagus spears (though they could use seasoning), chicken and potato salad.  The service was generally good, but with two strong sour notes: the indifferent, unsmiling hostess who made it difficult for us to obtain one of the many empty, more desirable tables that were available, and the staff dropping the ball after we finished our meal, keeping us waiting about a half hour for our check, ignoring us as they were focused on preparing for closing.  Even after a busser asked if we would like the check, we were kept waiting a lengthy period of time.  This meal was a bargain, $35, the Pittsburgh Restaurant Week price, including dessert.  This is the king of churrascaria restaurants.

PK-SrTMzUhGJcKvJIgcghg.text: Fogo lunch!  This is how you treat yourself. Market table buffet 15$ with many salads, cheeses, charcuterie, rice and fejodja bar. You can also get endless cuts of any specific meat for 6-9$. Or opt for the full experience for 34$.

mSgtoBe5d9_te3XYX62VZg.text: There is something magical about a good slice of picanha. At Fogo De Chao, the staff knows the power of a great cut of meat. Firstly, you could go for the Market Table alone and fill up, and it would be a top notch culinary experience. There's smoked salmon, roasted garlic, caprese, peppered bacon, multiple grain salads, fresh fruit, pickled vegetables of all varieties, and so much more. I've never ordered an entree here. Because Fogo De Chao is really all about the Churasco experience. If you've ever dreamed of sharply dressed waiters flocking to you with an endless cornucopia of fine meats, this option is a dream come True.  As previously mentioned, I'm all about that picanha life... But bacon-wrapped chicken, pork, lamb, and filet mignon are also floating around like delicious meat angels. Let's revisit  the Market Table for a second: it's like a Salad Bar, but an extremely grand salad bar. Besides the exquisite cold food offerings, there's also hot food... Including the most perfectly seasoned and prepared black beans you've ever had. Trust me! You want drinks? Fogo has a great selection of wines, plus a cocktail menu with a section featuring cachaca, a sweet spirit from Brazil. This spirit makes the drinks in that section of the menu VERY sweet (since cachaca is distilled sugar cane), but if you're the type of person who likes that, you've GOT to try one of these special cocktails.  Last but absolutely not least, the staff here are a team and work together very well to make sure you're attended to. I haven't had an unpleasant waitress or waiter here; They're all polite but also fun, and I felt at ease joking around with them on my few visits!  Please, at least once, go to Fogo De Chao. It is a memorable dining experience you won't regret!

wSoFrNHCyfRz6mezAKPZ6w.text: I attended to soft opening for Fogo a few days before the opening. Despite this being one of their first run throughs, the staff were amazing and very professional.  The atmosphere is very relaxed yet upscale. Waiters are there at every turn and are prepared to assist you or provide information on a particular cut whenever you need it. They pulled my chair out for me every time I returned to the table and always had a fresh napkin or plate after trying different foods.  The food variety was excellent. If you have never been to a Brazilian steakhouse, you are in for a unique experience. The "buffet" was filled with a variety of vegetables, hors d'oeuvre, cold salads, cheeses, and cold cuts. There was also a hot bar with rice, beans, and maple bacon. The presentation was lovely and the wait staff are there to provide info and a fresh plate each time you went back for more.  As far as the meats go, they bring around several different kinds on large skewers and shave off pieces for you to try. This is where the red and green card comes into play. Turn it to green when you are ready, but be prepared to turn it back to red pretty quickly or you will find yourself overwhelmed with the amount of times staff will stop by to offer you another sample. Don't worry if you miss something once around. You can wait for them to come back, or simply ask your wait staff for them to bring it back again. This occurred at our table and once our staff realized we were seeking something specific, they had it out within minutes for us to enjoy.  Definitely come hungry and take your time! There is certainly no rush and trust me, you can fill up easily on the buffet alone!

U5EIsRHaSWPRdJRaHoNYcw.text: Make sure you come hungry! If you're on the Atkins diet you're in the right place. It's a carnivores delight. To start off your meal you'll go to this fantastic antipasto bar. Believe me you could be very happy if this was all you were going to eat but be sure to save room for the meat because there's gonna be lots of it. It just keeps coming. I think they said that they were 17 varieties and having sampled about half they were all excellent. The antipasto bar had an incredible selection of everything you would expect and much more. Check look at a couple of pictures I snapped. Basically it's all you could eat for about 50 bucks, including all the meat. They had a decent wine selection and a full liquor bar. I would definitely go back here and would highly recommend it.

Uj-3k8zp0BKDmZfnf1Ut8w.text: I have been anxiously awaiting for Fogo to open!!    Went there for lunch today.  Was so happy with the lunch market table, which is a great deal! $15 for an outstanding selection.  The soup was great, the food on the buffet was constantly refreshed, and who doesn't love all you can eat charcuterie!!  Docking a star because the service needs some fine tuning.  We were there in their second day open, and you could tell the staff were overly anxious to have good customer service.  Unfortunately, it was incredibly annoying.  My party could barely finish a sentence before a staff member was checking in, taking out plates, cleaning the table, asking if we want dessert, every time we turned around someone was hovering at our table.  After our waiter butted in to ask us very probing and personal questions, It got to the point where we basically had to ask them to leave us alone so we could have a conversation. Unbelievably awkward!!

m0H61QIIHJYj7jpAqm-2mw.text: We had a party of 7 on Thursday March 28. We were seated immediately and someone came and explained the menu and how to order. All servers were extremely polite and friendly. We had no issues with service at all. Service was great from every staff member.  The place is decorated very nicely.  Very modern but warm too.    We went for the restaurant week promotion not realizing that's for the lesser cuts of meat.  We all upgraded to the full experience at $15 more because we wanted to try the filet and lamp chops.   The meat came at a fast pace and the two highlights were the sausage and the bacon wrapped chicken.  Those were the o oh things i had seconds of.  The filet was good. Tender but didn't have much flavor.   They told us they only put sea salt on it, which is fine but it was a bit bland.   One reviewer mentioned being told something was leg of jaguar.  We must've had the same gaucho because he told us various crazy things the whole time.  We found him to be hilarious and I personally thought he was the best part of the whole experience.   One time he told us he was offering us endangered roadrunner and another time said Tasmanian devil. .   Good stuff. I hope they appreciate him.    The managers and other staff constantly check to make sure you have everything you need and will bring a specific meat out if you ask for it more often.   The market table was nothing special.  Smallish salad bar. The best thing on it was the roasted cauliflower.  The dressings were standard and the veggies were all good and fresh.   Some stuff looked picked over and dried out, even right when they opened at 5 which was very strange (the salami and cheese section had a few shriveled ends of things. We didn't touch any of it). They had a bunch of interesting peppers though and everyone loved the bread at the bar rather than the cheese rolls at the table.     The sides:  they bring you mashed potatoes, bananas, polenta sticks, and cheese rolls.  Most of these sides went untouched.  The mashed potatoes were excellent though!    The busier it gets the slower the service gets.  I suggest going at 5 when no one else is there.  The market table was swamped at 630 when we were leaving but we had it to ourselves at 5.    Overall, I'm glad I tried it out. They validate parking in the garage that's on Oliver ave in their same building.

cdBviO7pvIQ-cL1MegxJ0A.text: Completely Amazing!!!! Thank you for a wonderful Mother's Day dinner! Our food was delicious, hot, and plentiful. Our servers were so kind, helpful, and personal. Thank you for your hospitality today!!!!! Nico was so accommodating and the Bacon is AWESOME!

UnvcRqbDihOY27lr4ZspmQ.text: Came here for the first time during restaurant week. We got the all you can eat Brazilian steak. Service was exceptional and the waiters came around with the steak very frequently. Love the idea of having a card to flip to state whether or not you want the waiter to stop by with meat. The salad bar was very diverse as well although I'm sure anyone that comes here isn't in it for the veggies. Would highly recommend for any meat lovers/as a place to take others from out of town.

7EdiIOtjqc2lCF4b4uRcKg.text: I have braised beef sliders, chicken sliders and polenta fries. All three dishes were outstanding but the chicken sliders are what I'll really be going back for. 7cGMLMssrSRkHDguno7g3w.text: Full disclosure: I attended Fogo as part of a food blogger event and my meal was comped but opinions are completely my own. While I'm not a huge meat eater I've always been interested in Fogo and was excited for the opportunity. There was an insane amount of meat, I seriously don't think I realized that many options existed! I was pleasantly surprised to enjoy almost all of the selections, particularly the filet and the lamb. I did not know how much I liked lamb but Fogo cooks it perfectly. The buffet should not be missed, especially the spicy bacon. It was a also nice to be able to add some veggies to my meal. Also highly recommend the polenta fries as a side dish for the table. I will definitely plan on going back on my own dime.

6MJx4Zr1F-s5jOcA8DW5CQ.text: Not a good experience. The restaurant is beautiful but over priced. The meats offered were ok. The salad bar was ok. Will not return.

AvYo7YjzafOFe6uofjrZww.text: It is a new location. The salad bar is smaller than the locations such as the ones in Chicago. The majority of the meat were a little too salty for our taste and bloody as well!  I was going to give a 3 but this location's GM deserves a shoutout!! He was the definition of a True servant leader! He was very attentive, helpful and professional!!! Kudos to him!

mSsXcLsb_JB3zK0YGUp1xQ.text: We came here during the restaurant  week. I'm so glad that we made reservations and it looks like a lot of people were waiting at the bar for a table. We were seated within 5 minutes. The menu was very big. They have different type of all you can eat. Depends on if you are hungry for some premium meat or not. The fresh salad bar has overwhelmingly amount of options but still wish they have more fruit options. All the meat tasted great and I was super satisfied only wish I could eat more. The desert we had was chocolate cheese cake and key lime pie. They weren't the best.  They do validate your parking ticket if you park at the correct parking lot. It is very confusing, bu call ahead and confirm which lot is their designated lot. We parked at the wrong one, if you coming up from wood st, the first lot is not the right one!

q_iomzGFz1ABx17CY3SZ3A.text: Food, atmosphere and service were okay. When I payed the bill, they also charged my credit card and extra of $34.29. I did not authorize or sign the credit slip (It was never presented) and when I called they were unreceptive to credit the unauthorized charge. I will never go back to any restaurant that is this dishonest.

iXTGNLE6oudSOombD2YktA.text: My friends and I spontaneously came here during restaurant week not knowing what to expect, but ended up leaving with full stomachs and looking for an excuse to return soon!  As soon as we were seated (which was very promptly), a waitress came and explained the menu very politely. We ended up going with the Brazilian cuts, which included continuous service until we decided we were stuffed. There was also a self-service salad bar that included a variety of leady greens, cheeses, cold cuts, fruits, and other sides that make you feel slightly less guilty for indulging on endless cuts of meat. They also bring you bread and buttery mashed potatoes to your table.  As for the food that we actually paid for -- the Brazilian cuts were amazing! They definitely cook and season their beef the best. Picanha, sirloin, NY strip...all so delicious! I personally love my steak medium rare and my friend likes her beef rare, so we had no issues with the cuts. But if you like medium to medium well, you will have to specify so they can cut the right piece for you. They also had other meats including lamb, pork, and chicken. But I found that some of these cuts were slightly too salty for my taste.   Restaurant week came with a free dessert. So of course, since there were 3 of us, we ordered 3 different items. The original cheesecake was my absolute favorite. The slice is very tall and has no added toppings/flavors but it didn't need em! Very indulgent but not too heavy. We also had the chocolate mousse cake, which was very decadent. I love chocolate cake, but this one was a little too heavy. Tasted great, but I definitely couldn't finish a whole slice. Lastly, the key lime cheesecake was my least favorite of the 3, although it was still very good. The key lime flavor was refreshing, but I didn't particularly fall in love with the key lime syrup on top.  But what REALLY changed this review from 4 stars to 5 is the amazing service we received. Remember how I mentioned that my visit here was spontaneous? Thus, my friends and I entered in our street clothes, and were mortified when we saw that a lot of the other customers were very dressed up and professional looking. However, we were treated with the same kindness and respect as everyone else. Secondly, the staff who came around with the actual cuts of meat were so friendly and funny and even remembered which cuts we enjoyed and how we each liked them cooked! I also love how professional they were and how well they followed the system with the "yes" and "no" cards. When we turned our placecards to the red side (shown in picture), we were able to eat at our own pace and converse without any interruptions. But as soon as we turned the cards to the green side, everyone was very attentive and offered more cuts in a timely manner. Lastly - the thing that touched me most - was when we were paying. We came with a gift card provided at a Yelp elite event. When we paid, the register was having some trouble with the gift card. However, the manager did not question or doubt us once, and accepted the amount on the gift card in full. I felt so respected and grateful for such kindness that was beyond mere customer service!   If you're looking for a higher-end place to eat for a birthday celebration, graduation get-together, or if you're like us and are just looking for some high-quality meat, I highly suggest coming to this location. You will not be disappointed!

dG8MT50IRZ3vJCi2Cwaomg.text: It took me a lot of time to decide how many stars to leave for our visit.  It was disastrous from beginning to end.  I don't have a real reason why I didn't do 1 star instead of 2.   Our visit to Fogo was rough.  To the point I don't believe any of us will go back.    1.  We had 7pm reservations.  I get that Friday nights are busy - but you had 25+ people waiting in the bar area to be seated.  I also respect that the way service goes - you can't always predict how long groups will stay.  But these sort of kinks should be worked out by now.  We were beginning to question whether we would stay for our reservation when we finally were called to sit at 7:40p.  2.  Almost immediately upon seating our waitress came and got our drink orders.  Finally!  Success - we thought.  Nope - we didn't get our drinks till almost 8:20p.  In regards to drinks - our other problem.  After we ordered our drinks - we never saw anyone again to get us more drinks.  There was 6 of us - we would have ordered multiple rounds - but no one came again.  To get water - we had to ask those serving meat to bring it.  We never saw our waitress (at our table) again.    3.  When you go to Texas De Brazil - you get all the meats.  Everything is one price.  But at Fogo if you want lamb chops, prime rib, filet - you have to pay more.  I get that those are more expensive cuts of meat and respect their decision to charge extra - but was disappointed to find out you had to pay more for a "different experience".  4.  This is just a personal opinion and is not reflected on how many stars i left.  But - I was not a fan of their seasoning.  I had a few coughing fits - and needed water.  Again - this is just my personal opinion.  All of this being said - I don't see a reason to go back to Fogo.  I had RSVP'ed for the Yelp event at Fogo - and have since cancelled my reservation because I don't need to experience that mess again.  I left quite disappointed and I don't foresee myself going back.

JjgGqQGFGhG3-L7gomgd7w.text: Spectacular!! Fogo de chao is pricy in general, but worth every penny, I went to that one a couple of days ago, the service is fast, friendly staff, amazing selection pf meet, and unlike other restaurants they dont keep you waiting for food with an empty plate.

vKHVya7fvabYA9G066FRww.text: Of course this is a well known chain with all you can eat cuts of meat but it's such a scam. My husband and I went for what we hoped would be a nice romantic "feast" and when we arrived it looked like there were people corralled into the restaurant. It was brightly lit with tons of tables and much louder than I had expected. The atmosphere was NOT romantic at all. It looked like a fancy cafeteria the way everyone was jammed in there. The restaurant was packed and luckily we had made reservations so we only waited about 15 minutes. There is a bar with salads and things you can pick at. It's kept very clean but they had run out of cheeses and a few things. They were running low on the lettuce. I feel like it could've been better maintained. Especially since they bank on the fact you'll fill up on "non meat" options to keep the prices down. Most people opt for the "Fogo experience" which advertises all sorts of cuts. We literally had them bring chicken around 3 times, bottom sirloin 3 times, and we had to ask for filet and ribeye which came at the very end. I was annoyed I needed to request it. There were about 10 different cuts and options advertised and I saw about half of them. They also sat us next to a service station and they reached over my husband for menus and water pitchers. It was definitely disappointing. I ordered a moscato and ended up with a Prosecco in an oversized wine glass because they had "run out of flutes". The staff was running around and asking the same questions because they work as a team. We were asked for drink orders twice and dessert orders twice by 4 different servers total. The mashed potatoes were good but cold. They brought a bacon wrapped steak that was beyond medium rare and inedible. The bread was cold. We ordered a molten and a creme brulee and it took at least 15 minutes for us to be informed they didn't have the latter. We will not be coming back.

TyQcfhU8AXuSjWLx38-smw.text: Waiter: How was your food? Me: The Fish was dry and rather tasteless, not very enjoyable. *waiter calls manager over, and relays the complaint*  Manager: Sir, well, this this a steakhouse...  *manager looks at me like I ordered incorrectly* so I'm thinking to myself, but you have lobster on the menu as well, therefore this is steak and seafood.  Why even have seafood on the menu if you can't prepare it right...  then have the nerve to dismiss a customer complaint and blame the customer for not ordering steak.  Anyway, my bad, won't happen again...

Fwj3mZZqd7ClYolQdk_Zmw.text: If you haven't yet checked out this amazing Brazilian steakhouse in downtown Pittsburgh, you are sincerely missing out! I've only been to one brazilian steakhouse before back in New York, and I'd say my experience at Fogo de Chao completely topped it. The all you can eat salad bar could be a meal in itself, with unique greens, vegetables and salad concoctions, including delectable fish options. But don't fill up just yet, because the best is yet to come. Skewer after skewer, the wait staff brought around different types of deliciously seasoned meat, with each subsequent offering better than the last. My personal favorite, filet mignon, cut like butter, and was absolutely fantastic. I highly recommend checking this place out!

kcEOxPyLcy2ocbmeKoBWHQ.text: I love this Brazilian restaurant! The server was very attentive and prompt. The menu was put into sections of varieties of meats with different costs for each section. Ak6FuDx4kARCXey4A0Rd_g.text: If I would have rated Fogo de Chao after my first visit I'd give it 5 stars ... second visit 4 stars and after my third visit I give it 3 stars ... we had 8 pm reservations on a weekend and the restaurant was open till 11pm but they did not replenish the salad bar or bring around meat as often as they did the first 2 times ... maybe they couldn't c our cards because they did not remove plates or drinks throughout service which was very slow and confused ... it's a bit pricey to just pick stuff that's left on the salad bar ... everything we did have though was very good ... i hope they're not going downhill already they're new to the area and it's a nice place to go !   I updated to one star because yes I went back and yes it was worse  We clearly had no waitress no bus person to remove dishes but we didn't even get plates we ate off tiny side dishes after asking numerous times for dinner plates  We received none of the things that came w the full meal no potato no rolls no polenta fries no fried plantains  No beverages  The meat was too salty to eat n they've gotten stingier with it and are not offering the better cuts  Awful experience

30wRnW_-N5TnWR7TpqdR_w.text: Fogo is the definition of food porn! Extremely delicious. The verity of food will have you begging for more! As the food comes out at appropriate times too! The service was absolutely phenomenal. We had servers named Jorge, And Nico and they were excellent! Thank you to all that has made our experience great! 10/10

7dtaFGnhuTt0jNwgRp0lFg.text: Went there for wedding anniversary and it was a mixed bag. The meats were all excellent. The young men and women who brought them were very attentive. One, especially, saved the night for us. You don't get an assigned waiter or waitress. They float. They don't have the logistics down yet because 75% of the way through dinner we still had NONE of the sides delivered nor the dipping sauces. When Daniel came by to offer us whatever delicious meat he had, he noticed this and went above and beyond to make sure we got all of it. He was not a waiter but he did a GREAT job putting the customer first and I commend him for it.  We were there for two hours and were checked on by a wait staff member ONCE... Until, of course, it was time to pay. Then they were REALLY attentive. Nice. If you want to eat beef eight ways and have lamb, chicken and pork, and you don't mind being totally ignored and experiencing BAD overall service, you might find it worth the fifty bucks a person.  Without Daniel, it was a sub-one-star experience. His efforts bumped it to two. Fifty bucks a person to be ignored and not receive everything the menu promises is NOT worth it to me.

4Emz5Sp9JHIbmiuG7ZfedA.text: Was able to try this restaurant and I can definitely say it is my favorite of all of the Brazilian steakhouses in Pittsburgh.  The staff was very accommodating when making a reservation and modifying the reservation to include more people.  And accommodating in providing bananas, uncooked for the babies at our table.  We were seated right away right in front of the window where all of the meat is cooking, so it was very entertaining.  The cold bar was quite large and had a very good variety of items on it that were all very tasty.  I had the strawberry hibiscus drink and it was delicious. I also ordered a Coke after that was finish and was pleasantly surprised that they had fountain drinks and I wasn't paying $5 for a 1cup glass bottle of Coke like some of the other restaurants serve.  The meats were all delicious, cooked perfectly, and not overly salty.  The only disappointing part was since we were right in front of the window we saw several meats that never made it by our table to try, despite being there over 2 hours.  I finally asked a server to send the parmesan pork my way so I could try it before I left.  The only area that was a bit lacking, and I will chalk up to being the opening week, was our server.  Several members of our party have never been to a Brazilian steakhouse, but I had to prompt him to explain everything in detail even after he asked if this was our first time.  And overall he was just very slow.  It took a long time to get drinks, desserts, bills, etc.

jXrPtBv_C6_QaTjHcbfTqQ.text: A very nice place to dine.  A decent menu and friendly staff.  I know this is new to the area and I hope with the few mishaps that people can see it is a growing period and they do not write it off. QmE7o34-wsZuGJBiO3O6dw.text: It's my 2nd time here and this time is during restaurant week. I understand it's a really busy week for them but I made reservations 3 weeks in advance. My fiance and I had reservations for 7:00pm. We walk in at 6:45 and there's a line for people who have reservations. PVJw3NpTqmuUCbZJ-ENXuQ.text: Meats were very good and plentiful. The market bar needs some additional items like rice/mashed potatoes as well as some desserts. Parking was free.

Uw7ZWlc-sYm8xXeYeJdyPA.text: Always a good meal when going to a Brazilian steakhouse, but these guys step up their offering with a ton of quality meats! I like the different tiers of meat offerings that you can order when you aren't extremely hungry and don't want to spend 60$. The salad bar has some great offerings as well, I'm looking forward to getting back here!

MaDote47kDExJdVZ4wTd4w.text: Absolutely fantastic restaurant that is sure to leave you full for a couple days after every visit! So far I've been to Fogo de Chao 3 times, the third being during Restaurant Week. Sure enough their restaurant week menu featured the Brazilian Cuts with a dessert at the end of your meal, and of course access to their market table whenever you want.   If you come to fogo, definitely do either the Brazilian Cuts or Churrasco experience. I have done both and after all the different options walking around, I didn't really miss out on the filet mignon or the lamb chops, which you get only with the Churrasco experience.   Some pro tips: 1) don't fill up on the rice and beans despite how delicious they are. 2) use the market table to your advantage, DEFINITELY get some mild/hot peppers along with some roasted garlic and pickles to cut through the fat on some of the meats. 3) pace yourself but don't pace yourself too slow, you'll have plenty of options walking around the room so don't wait too long and feel full before you've had a chance to at least sample everything. 4) I recommend the "3 plate method" one plate for your market table selection, another plate which you eat from, and a third smaller plate for chicken bones/anything else you don't want to eat.   Once you've battled your way through every meat possible, throw in the towel as you've fought a tough battle of willpower....and ask for the dessert menu. Their lava cake and papaya cream are absolutely delicious. I have yet to try their tres leches cake but it looks incredible - next time!

MkU1iODp4L1vZ7C79NNJ9A.text: Stopped for an early dinner after a play in the South Side.  Convenient location right across from a parking garage. Restaurant is large and very open. The buffet portion is great. Not average by any means. Smoked salmon, star fruit, candied bacon, and awesome homemade croutons.  Watch out for the bacon - it can be zesty!!!  The selection of meat that came around was good - the pork and bacon wrapped beef tenderloin was good.  Nothing was crazy good - but we got their "basic" offerings. It was $35:person special.  Staff was wonderful. Had a little trouble understanding some of the guys coming around with the meat.  Spoke really low. Felt a little embarrassing to have to keep asking them to speak up.  Dessert was included too. We had the cheesecake with chocolate drizzle and key lime pie.  Both were great.  Wouldn't do this often but I would go back. It was fun.

q05Xi4dFqgxG7Lf8fXGGyw.text: Food allergy/Gluten-free review:  I have been to other Fogo de Chao locations in the past, but it has been a few years since I have gone to this Brazilian Steakhouse chain. As other reviews have stated, this is a great option for a date night, special occasion, or when you're hankering for the meat sweats. It is a traditional Brazilian steakhouse where the entire meal is based around fresh-barbeque and roasted beef, pork, chicken, and lamb, as well as unlimited side options and fresh salad/market bar. I write most of my reviews based on the restaurant and staff's ability to accommodate gluten free and allergen free diners.   My favorites of the evening include the crispy polenta side and the Picanha (sirloin), which is the signature meat of the restaurant. I could have just eaten that all night. It's absolutely on par with other steak houses in the area.   This is one of the most gluten free diet-friendly chain restaurants I've ever been to. The unlimited sides, including Brazilian cheese bread (PAO DE QUEIJO), which are made with Yuca flour, crispy polenta, garlic mashed potatoes, and carmelized bananas are all gluten free. All of the meat options are gluten free EXCEPT the chicken legs and chicken thighs, which are beer braised. The chicken breast wrapped in bacon is gluten free.   In addition to being gluten free, I also have many food allergies. I contacted the corporate office the day of my reservation and they promptly e-mailed me an allergen list for every item on their meat menu, sides, and market bar. I was pleased to see that many items were soy, egg, and milk free (all of which are common allergens). In addition to this, because I had let the restaurant know of my allergies ahead of time, the  the waitstaff was already alerted and took care of me the rest of the night.  Food allergies or not, I highly recommend this restaurant. Everything is cooked to perfection and absolutely worth the money. Save your appetite and feast away!

HpFehxYDwkiH5HEICQnyng.text: My boyfriend and I have been to Fogo a few times, but our most recent dining experience made us want to become regulars! The food deserves a review of its own, but what compelled me to write one is the great service  The staff is personable,friendly, and accommodating. I enjoy that all members of the staff are willing to answer questions, send a certain cut to your table, or serve you even if they aren't "assigned" to your table. They welcome you with a smile and are wonderfully entertaining.   We will definitely back soon, especially to take advantage of restaurant month!

N3uH1J_29T06YEE73MdCbQ.text: Decided to try this place out for restaurant week. I had some issues with trying to get reservations by phone. I was told by a hostess via telephone that there were no seats available for the entire evening. I managed to reserve a table anyway through the Open Table app. Arrival was slightly off putting as I stood in front of the hostess counter waiting for staff to greet me but she instead greeted the people behind me who just came in the door. After making it to the table our waiter thoroughly explained the options and how everything work. He was marvelous. The salad bar was clean, well stocked, and I most likely could have been satisfied just eating that. Sadly our table never received any crispy polenta, mashed potatoes, or caramelized bananas which was kind of a bummer. The meats were continuous and well seasoned. I felt like there was a really good variety of things to choose from as well. For dessert I got the key lime pie which had a nice flavor but was lackluster due to the fact it was so warm. It must have been sitting out for a significant amount of time. We were completely finished with dessert and had our checks cashed out by another server whom we never saw the entire meal prior to paying. As we were getting out coats our waiter was like you didn't even have coffee yet?  I'm pretty sure I couldn't consume another thing at that point but it would have been nice to have that offered with our desserts.  Overall I would probably give this place another try at some point but I do feel there is some lacking in staff communication. The food is high quality and the atmosphere is wonderful but if the staff isn't working together to make the experience seamless  you end up with a mish-mash of mixed emotion guests.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My very warm but still tasty key lime pie
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Entrance

6aeMY9HmRKN9rkr9RiU5Bw.text: Amazing meal. We started at the salad bar. This is not your ordinary salad bar, cured meats, roasted veggies, smoked salmon, fresh fruit, watermelon and feta salad. Don't forget the bacon. The quality of the ingredients/food was so superb and fresh. If you are not a big meat eater, i suggest this. However if you do the meats you get this anyways.  Now the meats, flip that coaster to "yes please" and be prepared for seasoned and rendered meats. Perfectly cooked to your liking. I been to steakhouses around the city and have to say this tops them by a mile. Also the service was great. They were very attentive, friendly and took care of you.  Definitely coming back for some lamb and that salad bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Not too heavy lighter and refreshing cheesecake
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crispy polenta and carmelized bananas.
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummy

Hgi0xd4Nt7o4NcYdICGhSg.text: Just went here for the first time for an event. I was very impressed with the selection of food. They have a salad bar with an array of choices. It would be a perfect spot for a quick lunch or a great dinner. Their bar is really nice and stocked with anything you would want. They also have some very unique wines to choose from for dinner. Whether you are a meat lover, vegetarian or pescatarian, this place has options for everyone. For the meat selections they have the classic red/green coin system for asking the server to bring more options over to your table.   Overall, the service and food were excellent. If you haven't tried this place yet, give it a shot. Parking is easy too. They have an attached garage in the rear of the building and also a parking garage diagonally across the street.  They are currently building some housing units above the building but that doesn't impact anything at all with the restaurant so don't be deterred by that aspect. Well worth a visit!

0pxKflkWP_S6InwWZsa4dw.text: Fogo de Chao proved to be one of the best on customer service.   We had a bad experience on my 50th birthday. They heard our complaint and invited us to try it again on wife's 49th birthday.  The service was 5 stars. The general manager Jair and Nico received us as family. It was fun to interact with the whole crew during dinner. All kinds of cuts were served... it was overwhelming. I could barelly deal with all options of meat.  Thanks to everybody at Fogo de Chao Pittsburgh!!! We will come back!!!  Hasta la vista!!!  Voltaremos!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

8ZfTjmIO89nEl99k0XBoBw.text: Another steakhouse has opened in the downtown area. Like we need more with at least 3 others down here already? However, since it is Brazilian inspired I decided to check it out.  I had a reservation made with open table and when I arrived at my scheduled time which was when they opened, I was told I had to wait 15 minutes because they weren't done setting up. The place had just opened for business and no one was there!  Have researched the business on the web I learned that the offer free parking in the Oliver Garage after 4 on weekdays and $10.00 parking in that same garage at lunch with validation. My visit was on a Sat and on Sats and Suns they serve brunch. The brunch includes their famous "market table" which to me seemed like a glorified salad bar with specialty items and behind it was a hot items which consisted of your usual breakfast fare (sausages,bacon, etc,) along with Brazilian made hot items to compliment it.  During brunch you cannot order Brazilian cuts or select cuts but if you want those meats then you would need to order the full churrasco experience. Your server would hand you a two sided card (green and red) that includes an opportunity to scratch off a code to enter online to win a trip to Brazil. Basically what happens is that servers will come to your table with long skewers of meat as long as you have the green side up and they will carve off the portion you select. Once you turn it over to red then they will stop coming to my table.  I finally had a nice waitress seat me and a wonderful lady named Rebecca wait on me. She was very attentive to my needs and appreciated all the help she gave me. I had noticed on the menu that they offer mango chilean sea bass as another option during brunch. I could have it ala carte or with the market table. Learning that the fish already comes with asparagus, mashed potatoes, and caramelized bananas with a Brazilian style lady lock, I figured that would be plenty for me.  She asked if I wanted to start with jumbo shrimp cocktail as an appetizer which I declined. That appetizer is way over $20.00 and is not listed on the menu. The restaurant has a full bar and a notable wine list which I also declined.  People have asked me "why would I order fish in a Brazilian steakhouse?" Simple, when you come as a group not everyone wants steak and I wanted to see for myself how their how their Brazilian style fish was.  All the tables are numbers which are for the server's convenience. Although this place appears elegant I did see a few people wearing T-shirts and jeans.  I was told I had to wait 15 minutes for my food but in the meantime she started me out with Brazilian cheese filled rolls. They are gluten free and did not come with any butter. I found them bland and wasn't impressed with them.  When I finally got my meal I found the fish moist, tender, and there were no bones. It was indeed an excellent choice. The asparagus which it sat on was cold so they promptly brought me out a replacement which was much better. The whipped potatoes came with a spoon and like she had told me,  the caramelized bananas were like a dessert unto themselves. They were very good and you can get refills if you want more. The lady lock was fair but I was really impressed with the fish and the other sides.  When I was finished she did give me a dessert menu. Desserts normally run close to $10.00 each. Rebecca recommended that I try the papaya and vanilla ice cream and they come and pour a liqueur over it since it was light. I went for it and a server poured the amount I desired over it. It is indeed light and had that melted taste to it, however, it was very good and not overly filling as I had hoped.   This place is very pricey and believe me you do get tons of meat with the churrasco experience. The market table extends on a long oval shaped ice bed with a vast selection of soups, vegetables, cheeses, charcuterie board, and some seafood to compliment your meal.   To me this place is a work in progress since they have recently opened. The decor is beautiful and very laid back. Families are welcome to eat here. Special pricing is given for children under 12.  Located in the building that once housed Saks it is conveniently located near pubic transportation. WiFi is available and they will graciously input the passcode into your mobile device.

mKei9pxOKhvdvZdDex3rAA.text: Took someone 15 minutes to great our table of 7 and once we ordered drinks it took 40 minutes for them to bring the drinks to our table. I do think the only reason they were ever even brought was because I went to the hostess stand to ask if she could check on them. The meats were fatty and way over cooked. I would never return here again. Overpriced with bad food and poor service. If you are looking for a good Brazilian Steakhouse then try Texas De Brazil.

tRzfY18l8tXPqYEGRRnfFQ.text: The place is overall  great and the ambience is upscale.  It is not my kind of place though. I particularly do not like the setting of the Brazilian style steak houses because you can not have an intimate or a business appointment there. Too many  interruptions and food is coming and going.  The place is   for  a family or friends get together but it is expensive and it is not good for kids. I was there for a business meet and I only started the conversation after we all ate. Of course they did not rush us. The cocktails were very good. The meat was really good and the bar with salads, fruits is tasty with a big variety. The also bring shares dishes on the table for sides. The place is clean with nice lighting and decor.  Out server was not very good but the rest of the staff was helpful. I would come back but not for business meeting.  Maybe for a girls night out.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The ambience

oK0397APDTV7SGydVcNLSA.text: Excellent service and delicious food. If you have been to Green Forest Churrascaria or Texas de Brazil, then you pretty much know how these Brazilian steakhouses work. They give you a round medallion, and when you turn the green side up, the roving server carrying meat on a skewer will stop at your table.    There's also a salad bar with lots of cheeses, salads, and sides. They bring you mashed potatoes, fried polenta and plantains to your table.  The wines by the glass run about $11 - $14, and the Argentine Malbec Alamos I tried was very good ($11 a bottle in the PA State Store).   Everything I sampled was delicious and piping hot. Servers were very attentive and helful.   Vegetarians will find plenty to eat at the salad bar.   The dining is upscale, so if you enjoy dressing up for a special evening, you will not feel out of place. Every customer I saw was dressed casually.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salad bar
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

HidJmxIChVkWrQ2ZREXU5w.text: Yesterday (Mother's Day 2019) was my first time there, but it won't be my last! We had reservations for a table of 9 and were seated immediately upon arrival (5 minutes early). We were immediately greeted by our server who had our table filled with water in mere moments. Within ten minutes upon our arrival, the delicious meats started circling our table, and didn't stop coming until you said you needed a break.   The chartreuse and salad options were nothing but the absolute best, and plentiful. There was imported hearts of palm, fresh roasted cauliflower with asparagus, marinated roasted red and yellow peppers, fresh fruit selections, several varieties of peppers, aged cheeses...this is to name but a few of your selections! You won't believe how delicious their bacon is unless you try it for yourself!   The variety of meat was exceptional with various options and cuts of beef, pork, lamb, chicken, all seasoned to perfection. Everything was moist and delicious.  We felt like royalty with all the friendly staff constantly checking on us. Our glasses never were empty, and neither were our plates. If there was a particular meat you wanted, all you had to do was ask and within moments, your wish was fulfilled.   Your parking is complimentary if you park in the garage located above their restaurant. Although the prices may seem high for some, you are absolutely getting your money's worth for the quality and selection along with such experienced chefs and staff.  We have already made reservations for our next visit! I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a fine dining experience.

43ERV1jq_ZNYU_EitqB5nA.text: Fogo.... be ashamed, be very ashamed!   You are a disgrace to Pittsburgh Restaurant Week!  Waitress was openly pissed that we were ONLY getting the special menu... totally ignored us throughout the meal! The food was sparse, dry and always cold and all of the better cuts of meat were eliminated from our choices! We had a table of six and at times waited 10 minutes for the servers to even come to our table!    I guess you don't care if people ever return to your establishment.... we surely will not and we'll make sure our friends don't either!   Pittsburghers... go to Texas De Brazil if you want the Gaucho experience.

P_cHqGxDCT7wLUMwV0y1zQ.text: My family had reservations for fogo de chao two weeks ago, and I'll go into the good and the bad.    The good:   We were seated immediately and helped right away.    The gauchos: they were hilarious and attentive!  They'd joke with us about what type of meat they were serving every time they came by.    Most of the food: the garlic mashed potatoes, most of the meat, and most of the market table were great, very tasty!! Oh and the bacon was so good that we went back for seconds and thirds of it.  The bad:  The price: we  were  sold on going based on the restaurant month price of 35 dollars, but it actually didn't include the prime cuts of  meat, so it was the same price as it would have been without a coupon. They just don't tell you until you walk in the door. We ended up all doing 50 dollar dinners, which didn't include dessert.  Some of the meat: some came out rubbery and/or massively overcooked or raw. The ribs were extremely dry and tough.   Service slowed as the evening went on: at first, when we were one of a handful of people there, we couldn't keep up with the meat being brought to us. Later, we rarely had people coming to the table. Wasn't a  dealbreaker by then because we were getting full, but still.   Overall, we had a  great night and enjoyed the meal!

c0eSul5xsblWs2tA8KfkPQ.text: It has been a little over a year, and I felt it important to update my review.  My family and I love coming here, and my kids have become addicted to coming as well.  The waitstaff, as I stated in my previous review, are phenomenal.  They are so great with my kids.  The gauchos, as well.    They treat them just as if they were the adults.  The managers are constantly stopping by to ensure all of the guests are happy.  They, too, are phenomenal with my children.  Can't say enough how much we love coming here.

w1Bl7htMS4_T11ilgXFCBg.text: During my previous dozens of visits to this Brazilian steakhouse, the service was better. The food still tastes good, but the service now seems to be declining in quality. For example, when my husband asked for a particular meat from the server, the server ignored him and walked away without cutting off a serving. Another time, when my husband said NO to a particular meat from another server, she gave it to him. ?!?! Another server had the nerve to instruct me on how to use my knife to cut my meat.

649TBB0NFZGt9KqtJtBuZQ.text: I've been to the location in Pittsburgh twice now and it's been great both times!!   It's really tempting to fill up on the salad bar/buffet because they have such  great selection of cured meats and cheeses (my favorite) but definitely make sure you save room for all of the carved meats.  The first time I went I tried just about everything (the chicken, pork, beef and lamb).  But I'm really there for the steak! So the second time I learned and passed on the chicken and pork and only had one piece of lamb so I could try all of the cuts of steak.    They are also very accommodating here.  My little brother doesn't eat steak so they made sure to come around frequently with the chicken and pork for him.  Also, if you really want to try a certain cut of beef, you can ask them and they will make sure they bring it out to you the next round.  That being said, I probably would not go here unless you eat meat.  I've seen some reviews complaining about a fish dish from here but I mean, its a STEAKhouse and they bring different meats to your table, so I'm sure that fish isn't really their specialty.    ALSO - even though by this point you are probably SO full, do NOT pass on dessert.  The Tres Leches Cake is AMAZING.  Overall, it's a nice place for a date and a fun experience for a family.  The food is great and the staff has always been really friendly and attentive.  I definitely recommend (as long as you eat meat!)

tc7u_6_keg4xVWMvI-459g.text: I would give this place zero stars if possible. If you like being treated like poo, this is the place for you. I've had great experiences at other locations, but this one needs to get it together. It has a great atmosphere, but it took over an hour to get our first morsel of food, even with reservations.

Pzn7OxJMLK_DXcB-_gd07Q.text: A fancier version of Texas de Brazil minus the increase in quality of food. The staff are very kind and made sure we always had enough shareable sides but I'd prefer Texas de Brazil any day. Make sure to only go on a busy weekend night or you'll only be offered 1/4 of the selection of meats. We had the same cut of meat come by the table so many times we weren't sure that they had anything else (which now makes sense why they made sure our sides were always fully stocked, they were probably trying to distract from the lack of meats) and drinks took an exceptionally long time to get to us for there only being 5 tables full in the restaurant. I ended up paying for the full experience but only ate off the salad bar due to the lack of meat options. Very disappointed, won't be back. Giving 3 stars mainly for the ambiance and staff friendliness.

9ILZ4M20VPj51d7BUIsCPA.text: This is my favorite Brazilian steakhouse chain! I honestly think Texas de Brazil pales in comparison. They just do it up... Not only all the meats, but the buffet is on point! You could honestly come here as a vegan and still get a killer meal off the salad bar, I kid you not!  My favorite of the meats has got to be the lamb. I want all the lamb! I think there's maybe 3-4 different choices, which is shocking. They're just so tender and juicy. I can't even remember the other steaks I like, because I love the lamb so much. I keep my eye on the prize for the people walking around serving the lamb.   Like I said, the buffet is amazing. There's a candied bacon that I could swim in. I love all the veggies, cheeses and salads too. I fill up on hearts of palms like I'm never going to eat again. I think it makes me feel fancy. I also am a huge fan of the cheese bread served at every table. I'm gluten free and it's a naturally GF bread and DELICIOUS.   Seriously, pace yourself, there's a lot to eat here. Maybe just don't eat at all for the day until you come here, then dive in to all the meats and more!

ZPwuYd8mkInBLC3Xjz2pNQ.text: Celebrated my birthday at Fogo and I can't say enough about how great it was! The atmosphere, the friendliness & excellent service of the staff were beyond all my expectations! Then there was the food. Oh my goodness, the food! From start to finish everything was delicious! I plan on going back soon to try their brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

nGT_adC3P2O30fuhwsuivA.text: It's Fogo de Chao -- meat-lovers' heaven! I'm very sad I missed the Yelp Elite event last year ( I had to cancel my RSVP last minute), but I dined here twice since then.  It's the similar consistently awesome Fogo experience as I had at the other Fogo locations: fresh salad/hot bar & quality non-stop meat. Another surprise of this Pittsburgh downtown location is the price -- less expensive than average Fogo in other cities, which means you can get the same wonderful Fogo experience for less.
