HxVLf8YoRNddZYxLoRODQA.text: First of all,  It looks and feels like money.   The look of the restaurant is ah-may-zing!  I have been to other Brazilian style steak houses and I have to say that the quality of the meats served elsewhere have been lacking or they had lackluster salad tables. (E.g., Cheaply made sausages with bits and pieces of off-tasting meat and flaccid salad offerings.  Yuck!)  I can honestly say that was NOT the case with Fogo de Chao.  All of the meats that we tried were high quality meats that were perfectly seasoned and prepared.  Chicken breast meat is EXTREMELY difficult to prepare on a large volume basis (It often comes out dry and similar to chicken flavored sawdust. )  The grilled chicken breast that I had was actually JUICY!  Literally, juice was oozing out of the meat as soon as I cut my portion.  The pork chops and lamb chops were next level and if I could have, I would have stashed several of those in my purse to gnaw on later.  They were just that good and flavorful.  Damn!  Damn! Damn!  I wish that had some now.  My lunch mate and I actually chewed on the bones to get the last bits of meat.  And that ribeye steak and some other beef cut that I had were sublime.    And that "market table" was no joke.  My lunch mate said that they would come back to Fogo just for that and the fejoada.  Top quality ingredients all around.  And our wait staff couldn't have been more accommodating.  Everything kept being refilled and plates swept away so quickly, it was like being in a Harry Potter movie.  It's a little pricey, but well worth it in my opinion, to just go ahead and get the full meat offering.  I will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheesey deliciousness!

qrRqXSgEgmhuuMuyaEbCXw.text: I went to "Fogo de Chao" with My Parents on 9/6/19 to celebrate "My Birthday" and We had a really great experience! First, all the employees were very kind and professional. The meats all came out nice and tender! One of the employees came around and nicely asked if there was anything they could bring us (referring to the cuts of meat) and I responded with lamb chops which is one of My top liked items here. They did not have any ready but were very kind to put some on the grill for Me in which I did not mind waiting. One of our servers, "Evan Russell," was very polite and nice to My Family and even offered up some great recommendations on how to experience "Fogo de Chao." I think "Evan" would make a really great Manager because You can tell that He really knows his stuff. "Fogo de Chao" is really great for Birthdays! I used My $25 off B-Day reward and they still gave My Family a free Dessert as well in which they gave it to Me with a nice personalized touch!" I ordered the "Papaya Cream" which is one of their featured desserts. It is light but very tasteful and I feel it was a great finishing touch to our meals! I will definitely be back at some point!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Papaya Cream!

1m32CLkTUlm1zY7NlmInCg.text: Recently I went here to attend a Yelp event.  True to their word, Fogo de Chao is all about the meats.  Our meal started with their salad bar which had a expansive array of foods including meats, cheeses, vegetables, breads and soups.  You could easily make a great meal just off the salad bar.  Once that was finished they began to bring around the meats.  A simple card system is used to order more meat - green for more, red to stop.  They have a great variety of meats and the ability to prepare it to your liking.  I usually don't like well-done steaks but had some pieces done over their open flame grill with a slight char that changed my mind a little.  The chicken and pork options were also excellent.  The servers were also very good and took the time to understand what you wanted and could go get it if they didn't have it out on the floor at the time.   I also enjoyed some of the drinks they had from the bar.  Specifically the Brazilian Gentleman, a bourbon with passion fruit drink served chilled.  One of the best bourbon cocktails I've had.  All in all I had a really great experience and think it's a great location for dining with friends.  Come hungry.

Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beautifully done

iOUrvhWQ_IrvK3t8Ppb5OQ.text: As someone who doesn't love meat I always thought I wouldn't enjoy Fogo. I had the pleasure of visiting for a Yelp event in February and I was thrilled to come back. I have to say I had an even better experience when I came back.   We started at the bar for some drinks before our reservation. The bartender was super friendly and the drinks were delicious. They have some decent drink and appetizer specials for happy hour.   I have to say this time around I was more impressed with the market table. I think with the large yelp group it was probably hard to keep it all stocked. It was much better this time and I can see why people rave about it. Even as someone who doesn't love eating meat that often I was very pleased with the meat. Multiple different options and everything was delicious! My coworkers and I will definitely be back very soon.

RwXgLKIZs_kEKV_OhIgRMw.text: The staff here was absolutely incredible! Food was great and service was even better. Shout out to Nico and Ryan, the bartender who went above and beyond!

_i8wNOEawer3cK6jAzOCNg.text: I gave this review a stretching 4 star review.  Only because the first time I went (yelp event) the experience was a 5+ stars.  I decided to take my family back to experience this place for themselves and upon attending the said Yelp event I was given a very generous $50 gift card to return.    I was so excited for them to try this place because of how great it was the first go around,   they just weren't that impressed and frankly neither was I.  It wasn't the food, the Gaucho chefs were phenomenal,  the food was great, our server was what killed it for us.  He appeared annoyed when we told him we wanted the restaurant month pricing, he muttered sh** under his breath every single time he approached our table. I'm really not sure why, we were all pleasant and did not complain about one single thing.    The bar was not quite stocked as it had been for the event that I went to this time around and I wanted my family to try the sweet, crispy,  delicious bacon... however we were there for an hour and a half and it wasn't restocked until right after we paid the bill.  My Brazilian cocktail that Jade (the super awesome bartender) made me the first time was just not so great this time.  Jade obviously did not make this one... anyway I will need a long break before returning to this place.

_aMOUp8kGO7azHYD0wHnCQ.text: Service is slow, food is somewhat tired and there are not as many options as Texas de Brazil. Out of the Brazilian steakhouses in the Pittsburgh area, I have to say this one ranks last for me. It took maybe 15 minutes after a friend and I were seated till we got our water. There were not many meat options and halfway through our meal I grew bored. The best cuts of meat I tried were the lamb and chicken wrapped in bacon. I also had an issue with one servers, he seemed really obnoxious and kept putting the meats he cut in my vegetable plate when I had a whole separate plate with my other meats. I felt like he was doing it to rub it in my face. He also gave me meats I did not want to because he assumed since my male friend got some, I would too. I was not enthused by this service.   The cheese bread is not as fresh as Texas de Brazil. It was too hard and not cheesy or stretchy at all. The one redeeming quality of this place is that they had papaya in their appetizer buffet. It was so tasty, plump and sweet. The dessert I ordered was the papaya cream which was so rich and fresh tasting. It was topped with some Creme de cassis liquor which really satisfied me. Would I go here again? No. I only went here one other time when Fogo opened up one or two years ago. I remember thinking that the cheese bread was not as good and that I preferred Texas de Brazil more. I came back here because i wanted to give it another chance. I'm happy I did, because now I know not to come back here again for dinner. However, maybe for the papaya dessert. It was wonderful!!

wa_iGUtNlE9VP5IOwsaI3A.text: After attending a Yelp Elite event here, we decided to go back and try out the experience on our own. Yes, it's a chain and yes there are other places around like it (some chain and some local). I've been to them all. I can honestly say that this is the best. The food is fresh and tasty. The filet mignon is my absolute favorite. I also really, really love the dry aged steak. The fresh bar has so many choices that you can eat from that alone and be full. In fact, it's an offering they have for lunch which I plan to go back and do next time. I love the endless meat and the sides, cocktails, service, ambiance and overall vibe from Fogo.  Again, it's a chain but a damn good one.

JYGGy7ZkQONbCfvyqiYKfQ.text: We have been coming here from the opening a few years back and the service has gone down hill since then- tonight was perhaps the worst dining experience my husband and I have ever had. First we visited the bar for caipirinha's and it took about 20 mins to be waited on. One drink took over an hour from arrival to payment. Then we proceeded to have dinner and my husband ordered the restaurant week special that was to come with dessert. Our server hardly visited our table and when it came time for dessert, they brought out cheesecake with nuts even though we ordered plain since we are both allergic to nuts. The servers claimed they were out of that kind even though the table next to us were just served it. When we asked what other options there were with no nuts, at first there were none. Then they told us they'd comp a different dessert off the regular menu. So we settled for a different dessert and ten mins later, the waiter came out and said he had nothing without nuts in it. Needless to say, we were now late to our show so we left without dessert. Overall, the staff had no clue what they were doing and it really showed. Sad to say I probably wouldnt go back to spend that amount of money!

NAM6eVQDUZKpxEVBuQlxWA.text: I had the best time here! My favorite part other than feasting on the delicious meats was the customer service. The servers were there right when I wanted another sample of something. It almost felt like a family meal where the host is feeding you left and right. A meat lover's heaven! It happened to be restaurant month when we came, so we all got a few dollars off and the dessert was complimentary. Free parking also doesn't hurt. We opted for the Brazilian cuts instead of the full churrasco experience this time and it didn't disappoint. Looking forward to coming back here again!

EocPbC3Apvh9WcRqe8W_Lg.text: Just enjoyed Sunday brunch with a group of friends. They recently upgraded their market table brunch to include made to order omelettes, Belgian waffles and the usual selection of excellent, high-quality ingredients at the market table area. Among other things, wonderful imported meats, cheeses, fruits and prepared salads. Goes for $28.95 per person but well worth it considering the quality and choices.

z5mh9OvH8PPhfT5XVBWHBg.text: What a nice  classy atmosphere. Started you off with there famous cheese  bread . Then move on to the salad bar . Calling it that doesn't even do justice it was so much more. Then the main event began. Meat meat and more meat  you just keep that green sign up and it keeps on coming. Everything had  a different flavor to it and you could get it from well to medium rare . My only critique would be to cook the chicken a little less ,was a little dry. Then just after you think you can't eat any more. You order  the cheese cake such rich flavor I was beyond stuffed .        The Servers and Carvers  had such cool personalities and did a great job at keeping the food and drinks  coming .Definitely recommend coming down and trying this out. FYI there is a parking garage at the corner  here and you can take the elevator down and the door to go in is right there!

EjuQsd-GXN1MjwBPtdVm_Q.text: tl;dr: Lower your expectations. Serious front of house issues.  This visit was a special occasion for us, besides my birthday, this was also our first "date night" out together since we had our first child. We'd been looking forward to this special night out for many weeks.  For the first time this year we got dressed up, wore clothes without spit-up on them outside the house, and left the young one in the care of a babysitter.  We felt fortunate to find the ad for "Restaurant Month" at the new local Fogo, offering what seemed like an incredible deal of a $35 per-person dinner, a substantial discount.  We made 5:30 dinner reservations so we could see a nearby theater showing at 7:30. My wife and I have visited Fogo de Chao's other locations in the past, in Atlanta and Boston. Based on our always 5-star experiences at those locations, we came in with high expectations for quality of food and service. We left in a rush to our show, and disappointed. The Pittsburgh restaurant does not meet the standard we had expected.  Our problems were foreshadowed pretty much as soon as we entered and approached the host stand. The hostess was talking to a woman who was asking to speak to a manager. The hostess seemed frazzled and uncertain of who the manager even was. The woman left the restaurant without talking to anyone, agitated. We were seated soon after, with very little wait, at our reserved time.  The table we got was very near the front door, which turned out not to be the best spot to get.  Our water showed up promptly and took drink orders. When we mentioned the Restaurant Month promotion, he stopped us and made sure that we knew that the promotion didn't include the "full Churrasco experience", which basically means that instead of being offered the full selection of meats you can select only from the less pricey cuts. The waitstaff had pretty clearly been instructed to push the up-sell on the full experience to restaurant month diners pretty hard, because we heard this spiel a few times as tables were seated around us.  The price difference was $15 per person ($50, standard menu price), but because of the promotion they would throw in a free mini-dessert for us. This was a special occasion, and I wanted to try all the cuts (especially, notably the filet mignon), so like most of the other tables we heard, we threw the discount to the wind and ordered the full experience, along with a couple of drinks from the bar.  Staff was not ready when the 8-top next to us got seated shortly after the adjacent 2-top. As that table got their orders settled we didn't see our waiter for over 20 minutes. In the end, we didn't get the free dessert I had ordered because due to slow service we ran out of time before our show, having spent over 100 minutes at dinner, most of that time it was us waiting on them. We did leave with an apology to-go dessert in the form of a key lime pie, which we gave to the babysitter.  The server did indicate he would have given us a 20% discount on the check for our negative experience there, had we not cashed out at the same time we ordered the dessert, which we did due to the poor service, anticipating that we might have to quickly leave.  The helper server for our section was also having her own problems, with the sides (and clean plates, which are the norm when switching to meats) taking a long time to arrive after we had started eating, and the cheese bread not arriving at all, until we demanded it after more than 15 minutes into the main meal. In fact, none of the tables around us received cheese bread at all.  The worst part of the experience was trying to get the cut I was after the most, the reason I had accepted the upcharge - the filet mignon. It just never came.  I asked literally every gaucho there, all six, to bring it to me. It didn't happen. Not until I flagged down our waiter and all but demanded the filet. He had to go chase down one of the cooks who, many minutes later, came straight to our table from the kitchen, and dumped a couple of cubes of the stuff that ranged in temperature from "cool to the touch and bleeding" to medium well. In fact, none of the "premium meats" they'd pushed so hard at the beginning were in circulation. Just lots of chicken and sirloin, over and over and over again. No bacon-wrapped filet, none of the most premium cuts. They never once made it to our table without us having to ask for it. It was just the cheap cuts repeated ad-nauseum.  In the end we were rushing out the door, not even having had time for the dessert despite all the time we spent there. The manager did check on our table, but we didn't want our frazzled and apologetic waiter to get into trouble, so we didn't report our dissatisfaction to him. But, there are indeed serious problems with the front-of-house at this Fogo location, and we will not be back.  There are also some likely backroom problems too, featured in this photo. Who would plate a plantain splooge like this? Yuck!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The black thing was a plantain in a happier part of its life.

e8r0Pd1Y24Tb-ZOa1WhscQ.text: Fogo. De. Chao.  You have outdone yourself.   Tonight was my first time visiting and I was very impressed! I was able to make a reservation for 5 easily through a simple google search of the restaurant.   This place is somewhat expensive, but with how great the service is and how amazing all of the food is - it was worth it.   As soon as you finish a serving, the servers are nearby to offer you more! You also have access to a salad bar, side dishes, and dessert all included in your purchase of the buffet.   The staff was phenomenal as was the food.  I can't wait to return!

TIlmmICMlDTPVP2b9HTZNA.text: This was my second Fogo experience, the first being in Boston for lunch. We did the restaurant month special which meant we missed the filet mignon and a couple of other meats. Overall the meat was very good, tender and tasty. The market table (really just a soup and salad bar on steroids) was good, but sometimes quality and taste is sacrificed for quantity. Overall it was a nice but not fabulous eating experience. I will add that I'm not a huge eater, but was able to have sample most of the meat without walking away with that awful feeling of being overly stuffed.   Like another reviewer noted, staff was lax about removing plates when you returned to the salad bar. This made for a crowded table at times.   The disappointment of the experience were the cocktails. They were very expensive and small. We arrived during happy hour, but learned that only applies if you sat at the very small bar.  Finally, if you are looking to take advantage of the parking validation, make sure you park in the correct lot. There are two, side by side and named Oliver Building, but only the one closest to the restaurant counts.

axnmthufiAmYU5drDO-YBA.text: I ordered a drink that was on Vodka guava and Prosecco apparently said they were out of the third ingredient. So I said maybe fix me a vodka and pick something else in it.  The bartender said what's your favorite color? I just wanted vodka in for Processo. Terrible 24 dollars and it was blue!!!

lGznMnhoL_yujwlYYufm7Q.text: Me and best friend had dinner at Fogo de Chao this week. Everything was delicious and as a brazilian that hasn't been in Brazil for 3 years now I was so happy to have some Feijoada, farofa, creme de papaya, picanha, palmito, pao de queijo e pudim de leite It was like having a little Brazil here in Pittsburgh, I will definitely come back  Also the attention you get from the waiters is something more than special that you will only experience in Brazil, Luis Miguel and Eric were out of the way to make me feel special and add to the experience, love it

CkkAtovL0EcZNlo8mi12DQ.text: The buffet is great but the meat is not bad it's very salty and you can tell it's been frozen for long.

prx-GhqZlH-_7cv8nIzNvQ.text: I guess I'll begin at the beginning because it's the very best place to start. We had a reservation for 8:15pm, didn't get seated until 9pm. I don't really that long at a restaurant I DON'T have reservations for. The waiter comes to the table and shows us the menu (the special was 35.18 for restaurant week, not even 4 dollars off, and it's not the full meal option and wasnt clarified on their website). My partner had bariatric surgery and he can't even get the half off of the limited experience, he HAD to pay half off of the full meal. We ask the waiter for a moment to decide and we're left alone for almost 10 minutes. Then a different waitress comes and when we showed her the bariatric card she had no idea about half off, even though we told her about their website staying it and she had to go ask the manager. Apparently it takes 15 minutes to ask the manager one question. She finally comes back and confirms the discount and takes our drink order, which we never received and it wasn't until the end of the meal that she noticed. So it's about 9:30 before we can even start eating. We get up to the salad bar and it is completely picked over. Literally 5 slices of salami and no cheese. The restroom was a messm paper towels all over the floor, the toilet looked like it hasn't been touched all day, and the sink had a huge crack in it.The only saving grace was the one waiter we brought our complaints to who was apologetic (but didn't offer anything other than an apology). Texas de Brazil has a better meat selection (while at Fogo de Chao we were only offered 5 different meats), their salad bar is larger, and have NEVER had to wait when we had a reservation). Will not go back.

-ZCxyko672tzmqIgj6plrg.text: This was the first Brazilian steakhouse I've ever been to, so I can't compare it to any others.  Like the others, it's pricey at about $48 for the "full experience" as they called it, but if you're going to go to a normal fancy steak house (i.e not Longhorn), you'll probably pay close to that and not get all you can eat, so it's not that bad if you think about it that way.  The first thing you try is the Market Table.  Sort of like a salad bar on steroids.  Definitely a lot higher quality and selection than most other salad bars you'll ever try.  Next the meat, they had about 7 selections to try.  They bring it to your table and cut it for you.  It was decent.  Not the best meat I've ever had, and the chicken was way too dry, but overall decent.  The only thing I'd really complain about was the side items.  Not that they were bad, in fact, I think they were better than the meat, but for our table of 2 adults and 2 children, they only brought out one little plate of mashed potatoes, and one little plate of caramelized bananas (which were awesome) and something else that was tasty but I don't know what it was.  I kept hoping they'd ask if we wanted more sides instead of meat, but they kept bringing on the meat.  Overall, it's probably not a place I'd go back to as we don't eat out at fancy restaurants very often, but definitely worth the experience at least once.

1-xckpA5ulcHwnBA9JlZaw.text: Extremely disappointing experience. Texas de Brazil is much better food for around the same price. Their market table has more options as well as numerous deserts that are included in price vs. at Fogo you have to pay for desert and appetizers separate if you want them. We felt scammed based on the fact that I ordered the full churrasco experience which is supposed to include all the cuts of meat in the Brazilian cuts option (which is what my husband ordered) plus upper cuts and I never got them. I finally after an hour questioned why we were only getting a few of the same cuts of meat offered to both of us and I wasn't getting any my husband wasn't getting as well as all the cuts listed on the Brazilian cuts option weren't ordered. Waitress said to keep with Brazilian custom the upper cuts aren't served until the very end and had no answer as to why we weren't getting all the cuts advertised for the Brazilian option. I complained that if I'm paying more, I should receive the upper cuts as well before I've eaten to where I'm full. I never received the upper cuts and then had to request I be charged for what I had. None of the meats were very flavorful and they did ask how wanted cooked and even though requested medium rare, they were all either medium or well done.

No0CM5K2CXkqfGhVF1aZ9Q.text: Absolutely delicious and a wonderful experience! This was my first time trying a Brazilian steak house and was joy disappointed. I was completely unprepared for the sheer amount of food! Take it from me, pace yourself. The restaurant is beautiful and clean. The service is on point and everyone is so friendly.   My favorite of the meats was definitely the bacon wrapped steak. It had amazing flavor, was cooked and seasoned perfectly.   The side dishes they set out are good as well, mu favorite was the caramelized banana. It was sweet and unexpected.  The market table had a terrific selection of salads,  fruits, vegetables and other items. My favorite from the market table was the candied bacon. I could eat a platter of it be itself!  Overall a great experience and will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

uUa-c_3nUCP-cxpV-CjeGA.text: Came here for their weekend brunch, which is around $40 per person, for their Fogo experience.  It includes the steaks, market table (their salad bar), waffles, and an omelette station.  What's hot - Quality.  Very delicious!  Their meats are tender and nicely seasoned.  Mine and hubby's favorite steak was the bacon wrapped steak.  Tender, flavorful, and just a bit smokey.  Their yogurt parfaits for their weekend brunch are not too sweet- the granola is a tad sweet with plain Greek yogurt  and there are fresh blueberries.   - Variety.  There's smoked salmon, artichoke hearts, hearts of palm, caprese, different cheeses, fresh kiwis, pineapples, guava, etc...  Their waffles looked good.  Freshly made with whipped cream on top.  Their omelette station made fresh for you.  Love the variety! - Service.  As we went through the food, a couple of their wait staff asked us if there were any particular meats we wanted/preferred.  We said we liked the bacon wrapped steak.  Ask and you shall receive!  They made sure to bring us a couple of portions of that.  Additionally, staff were good about clearing our plates and refreshing what we needed.  They answered our questions, were polite and helpful.  We also noticed they bring free cake for birthdays, which is cool.  Take note!  Haha...  What's not - Parking.  This place is downtown, so you gotta be prepared to pay for parking.  Because we came on a weekend, their parking isn't free.  According to their website, they validate parking and parking may be free after 4pm on weekdays.  We paid $4 for our parking, which is the parking garage right next to the restaurant.  Not that bad, given the location.  But be prepared. - Price.  It's $40 for the Fogo brunch experience.  This includes their waffle station and omelette station.  No brunch drinks included, like their mimosas.  But oh well, I can kinda live with that.  Hubby and I didn't try their waffle and omelette station even though we really wanted to.  We prioritized.  Haha...  We focused on the steaks and the foods we don't have the chance to eat much.  Given the amount and quality of the food, it's a pretty good balance.  Just be prepared that this will cost you and that you may not eat everything you want to try.  It's not a place to go on a regular basis. - Service.  We noticed that service slowed down toward the end of the brunch hours, because their staff started to eat after their shifts.  Nothing wrong with that, but be prepared.  We also came with a gift card and it took a while for them to do what they needed to do for that.  Why, we don't know, but whatevs.  Final answer Would definitely recommend and would definitely come back.  However, this is a place for special occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. From their market table

SgHx-i-vVAaP2FrD6I6TlA.text: Took my stepdaughter here for her birthday . I wanted her to have the " full experience" of great service and enjoying trying different foods she's never had ( she's 14)  So our waitress came to the table to take our drink order , my stepdaughter had several questions about the drinks , our waitress did not make eye contact and was looking elsewhere , so I asked her " is there an issue that you have with us?" Why aren't you acknowledging my stepdaughter ? She said she was looking at her staff partner across the room ( who at the time had his back turned to her so her response made no sense ) right there I knew her lack of interest in my child would affect her tip. Also no new rice or bread ever appeared on the buffet table . Bacon, several fruits , etc . They ran out and did not replenish ! At 50$ a person this is unacceptable ! We wanted the full experience .! What we got was 30% maybe ??? And I had to ask the hostess for dessert to celebrate my daughters birthday because I'm assuming our waitress forgot ....??  I will take my business elsewhere , we spent too much money to feel shunned !

xldNP0FQ6WoYy9srq61bHA.text: Another great experience at Fogo! I'm continually impressed by the quality, flavor, and selection of their food. Each time I go it seems like they have a new option I haven't tried before. The staff is kind and attentive. They can tell you about anything that you're eating and they'll inquire to see if there is something that you'd prefer to have more of. Even if you don't want to do the Churrasco/ all you can eat option, you can order individually off the menu.   They also have a full bar that would be great for happy hour. Plenty of bar seating option with a great  They made one of the best caipirinhas that I've ever had!! I'll definitely return!

zt0FnBqJxAK7c1-K-XVpnw.text: Got steak? This place certainly does! Fogo de Chao is a full-service Brazilian steakhouse. If you've never been, the experience is a carnivore's dream worth experiencing.  In addition to an appetizer buffet table (think fruit, vegetables, table meat cuts, etc.) and a small pre-set menu, diners have the option of purchasing a continuous service steak dinner. Here's how it works:  If you want meat, you'll flip a circular card to its green side. Pretty much immediately, you will be served by staff carrying trays of different styles of meat. If you need a break, you'll flip the card to its red side and service will stop. And you can go back and forth between green and red until you're good and stuffed.  Whatever you order, the food will be gooooood. Steak service? Excellent; and everyone will be able to pick a favorite from the range of steak and chicken (and bacon-wrapped steak and chicken) being served. The appetizer/salad bar? Very nice - a great way to nibble on lighter foods when you need a break from all the protein. Even the standard menu is pretty good; I ended up ordering salmon off of it during my last visit because I suddenly wanted fish, not steak. And who am I to argue with my stomach? It ended up working out, and I enjoyed a great cut of salmon while my family got their steak experience.  The only reason my review isn't five stars is because Fogo de Chao was seemingly not prepared for the crowd during my last visit on Father's Day. It took a looooooong time that day to get food ordered; to get drinks; to get our check...pretty much anything other than the continuous steak service felt like it was on the staff's back burner. One family member even commented that the bathrooms needed some TLC and restocking, too. Granted, every restaurant can have a bad day. But to not be prepared for the rush on Father's Day...I was admittedly frustrated and disappointed, especially after so many good past visits.  While that specific experience kind of scared me away from visiting Fogo de Chao for a holiday again, its service otherwise has been top notch. So I will still be back for delicious cuts of meat and sweet, carnivorous indulgence. Plus, I'll be back "just because" - and really, isn't that the best kind of dinner, anyway?

Lfcmguj6F6ni8TMVw_rUOA.text: If you're looking for a fancy evening out and a filling meal, you've absolutely come to the right place. I came to Fogo de Chao during restaurant week and ordered their buffet and meat meal for a great price. However, even without the discount, I would honestly say the food here is worth the given price point. They have an endless stream of gourmet meats offered to you by professional, knowledgeable wait staff when you flip your table card to green. If you want to take a break from meats, they also offer a salad bar with a wide selection of food! In the end, this is an all you can eat extravaganza with high quality food and an excellent, posh dining environment. I can only hope to one day be back!

OFkZh4izRTRj7xLigtKBiw.text: Came here for my husband's birthday and had a great experience. For restaurant month, they offered a version of their Brazilian meats experience at a discount so that's what we both had. It doesn't include a few of the meats like the filet mignon or lamb chops but it is still plenty of cuts. The top sirloin was by far my favorite. The Parmesan encrusted chicken, lamb, pork, bacon-wrapped filet were all delicious too. They bring some small sides to the table and there is a huge cold bar. I had some salad from there and mashed potatoes that they brought but tried not to fill up on those.   I had a red blend wine that paired very well with the meats and my husband was offered a glass of Malbec that was "extra" somehow (poured by accident for someone? I'm not sure. But we weren't passing it up!) and he really enjoyed it.   The dinner included a choice of dessert (there were 3 to choose from) and because we were celebrating a birthday, my husband was able to choose from the larger dessert menu. We shared the flan from that and it was delicious. Save room if you are able!  The decor is very nice inside, the service was fantastic abc special bonus - they comp your parking next door!! So no need to worry about that additional frustration downtown. We will return for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Birthday flan

r6TZ1Vf82ZI03SFZsWyrkg.text: I was no overly impressed by this place. We were greeted quickly at the front and sat by the manager. A server took our drink orders. Then another server came over to ask about our drinks again. Then yet another server came by ask about our drinks. We were very confused by who was our actual server by the end of service to get the check. Finally the very first girl came back and gave us a electronic book to do our check on. I wish she would've somewhat explained what to do with it. Poor service but it had a great time for restaurant week. I wouldn't return as it was my favorite place but my friends enjoyed it.

CREGlZe4L6lVl3iRpPVnGQ.text: What an awesome experience! Happy hour with Ryan was great! The dining experience with the staff, and a special shout out to Nico , was superb! Food was great. Cant wait to come back.

9n7uRlM1jXjXzu9on42ZSw.text: I went to Fogo with wife and son for my sons big 21st birthday. This was my first time at Fogo. We decided to go early and it was also a Tuesday. The place was empty when we got there I believe there was only one other table filled with people. All 3 of us ordered the Fogo Experience. The Fogo experience includes all the meat you can eat and the salad and soup bar. I would say the salad bar alone could be a meal and make you too full to eat anything. The service was totally outstanding among the best service I have ever received in any resuraunt ever. The salad bar was good and the selection was excellent. I tried a bunch of the different meats but in the end I stuck with the top round sirloin and the filet mignon. The actual steaks where good to be honest they where better than a lot of places but not the best I ever had. The experience is $50 plus drinks and tip by the time we where done it was $230 for 3 of us. I would say Fogo is a bit pricey. I would recommend it especially if it is not overly crowded. The service alone I would give 10 stars but the food I would say is between a 3-4 so I will give them 4 stars. I would probably go back again in the future as the food was good and like I said service was outstanding.

Qqoyqo8S0r1Zuhb17vdiSA.text: My plus one and I attended the Yelp event at this location and I throughly enjoyed my time!  [Drinks] My friend and I were greeted with the most refreshing "fogo caipirinha," one of the Brazilian cocktails. If you like lime, you'll enjoy this one. Also the red wine they presented at the tables paired perfectly with the red meats. The wine had a fuller body and was on the dryer side.  [Food|Appetizers] I had a chance to try the fresh shrimp appetizer. These shrimp super big, juicy, sweet and fresh! The cheesy bread (pao de queijo) was addictive. Though I hadn't tried the sliders, they looked amazing. The garlic mashed potatoes were straightforward yet delicious. I also tried a sweet-and-salty banana dish. The beef empanadas were sweet and chock full of meat. My favorite appetizer was most definitely the shrimp, though it didn't come with any sauces.  [Food|Market Table] The salad bar offers a variety of fresh veggies, amazingly sweet fruits and fancy cold cuts and cheeses! Strangely, I was most impressed by the quality of the fruit. The pineapple, honeydew and cherry tomatoes help cut through the fattiness of the meats. Of the meats, I liked the candies bacon the best. I also really liked the apple salad!  [Food|Meats] The top sirloin, tenderloin, rib eye and chicken leg were simply seasoned yet quality in flavor. The dry aged NY Strip was tender. The rib eye outstanding. I loved the pork sausage -- the seasoning, the snap. Although I must confess the meats were a bit too salty or at times over cooked for my liking.  [Food|Dessert] Yes yes yes. I was offered the original cheesecake, key lime cheesecake, and chocolate mousse cake. The plating alone was enough to impress me. The cheesecake was thick and beautiful. The key lime cheesecake was light, refreshing -- my personal fave. And the chocolate mousse cake was unforgiving in its rich decadence.  [Service] The main reason for the 5/5 review would have to be the staff. Although they were overworked due to such a hectic and demanding event, each worker was friendly, hardworking and upbeat. They really made for a memorable experience.  I would definitely come here again! Although prices do seem a bit high, they're worth it every now and then.

vmasBwPwLS7nMr54aOBioA.text: Amazing experience from start to finish. From the appetizers and drinks, to the salad bar, sides, and all the meat selections!! This experience is definitely worth the money!!  Though I tried so many different menu items, standout were hands down the enormous and well seasoned cocktail shrimp, the amazing chartreuse selection and fresh salad options at the buffet portion, as well as the filet mignon, aged steak, and lamb!  Every item of this meal was perfectly seasoned and cooked. The wine and drinks were excellent! The staff was fun, friendly, knowledgeable, and definitely enhanced the entire experience!!   I would recommend this place to anyone for a special occasion, or just to treat yourself to an excellent meal!!

PqPuW0NWUmlpKp8hW-BGfw.text: Truly a 5 star evening. Start to finish, greatly appreciated the opportunity to enjoy such an amazing restaurant.  This YELP event really took it to the next level with this one ! The appetizer wine food (meat) service was all top notch. I would recommend eating here and we plan on coming back. Not to mention you can park at this location or right across the street. Even the location is great  Overall can't say enough about the restaurant and the event ! We will be back sooner that later !

bEG49Cm1d4PGZaCC-6jg5A.text: My second visit to the restaurant and it was a great one!!! Valentines Day dinner!! Yeah the tables are rather close..but we requested a table along the window and it was perfect!!! I just love the salad/cold bar. I love all the cheese selections, salad, bacon,bread and vegetables. Everything was fresh and oh so delicious!! Our waiter was absolutely amazing .. Along with the staff ..we couldn't have asked for better service. I love the cocktail menu .. Cucumber mint cocktail is out of this world..So refreshing and full of flavor.   The mashed potatoes and platens were delicious. I love practically all the meat that was served and if I were to pick a favorite it would be the ribeye.  We got a side of steak sauce which was really nice to have.   I like my meat medium well which seems to be the standard but my boyfriend prefers well done. I was pleasantly surprised that they were able to provide my boyfriends preference several times!!   We did our best pacing ourselves but eventually got full. I even kept flipping my card over to take a break but eventually I couldn't do anymore.    The restaurant had special cards made for Valentine's Day that were in the shape of a heart, which was so cute and such a nice touch!!   For dessert we shared the molten lava cake which was outstanding.  It was a great special dinner and evening just like I knew it was gonna be. We can't wait to return!!

eV4P1GXWW12LmTTA-GBMxg.text: This is definitely a fun unique experience to try out at least once while in Pittsburgh. The service is excellent and the restaurant is very spacious.   We went here during fogo restaurant month and for $35 you get access to their market table, all the meats and a dessert!   The market table has a variety of selection of appetizers ranging some salads, a selection of meat and cheeses, rice, beans, soup, vegetables, etc. you can fill up on just this table alone so make sure you don't overdo it and save room for the meat.   Now on to the meat. There's about a dozen different rotations meats ranging from pork to chicken to steak coming that the waiters shuttle back and forth from the kitchen. At the beginning they give you a round plate that is green on one side and red on the other. If your plate is green that means you are ready for the meat, when it is red it means you are taking a break. The meat is overall pretty good. There are some meats I preferred less such as the lamb. The chicken was always fantastic.   Finally, for dessert we chose the key lime pie and cheesecake. As we were pretty stuffed from the dinner we took those to go and enjoyed them the next day.   We also ordered a bottle of wine which paired really well with our meal. Overall fun experience, definitely go make dinner reservations!

OWqzWcz21pahIIgf4IatVw.text: Delicious Brazilian style restaurant.  Lots of good meat options from the servers and at the "salad" bar, in addition to cheese and vegetable options.  Very friendly staff.  Pretty pricey, but a nice treat.

3ZuxMsLoBhlGqNDYy2YQGQ.text: At long last I have found the best Brazilian steakhouse in the 'burgh, possibly in the states! I generally trust fogo over other churrascarias because the meats are seasoned properly, they are a generally nice chain, and the grade of the steaks somehow taste much better than those from other chains such as Texas de Brazil (note to all yelpers: always choose fogo over Texas because the quality is so much better).   That said, this fogo location, despite its superior rank to all the Brazilian steakhouses in the 'burgh, outdoes itself by being, in my opinion, the best fogo I've been to (sorry LA, Chicago, DC, and Philly Fogo locations, Pittsburgh finally has something to be proud of). Although the classy look of the restaurant in Pittsburgh may be similar to the locations, the service here is completely unmatched. The Gauchos were really on their game and each of them, by the end of the evening, knew the exact level of doneness I wanted my meat. We never had to wait long in between cuts, which was very impressive for a restaurant of this scale. The other servers were also friendly and efficient at refilling drinks and side dishes. Bravo to the team, led by the enthusiastic and welcoming manager, Nico.   Regarding the meat - everything was perfectly seasoned (the right amount of salt and garlic) and all cuts were incredibly tender. I look forward to having special celebrations here!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Colorful salad bar!
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

fiToHmvazJmBa-zP7drUyw.text: Visit for the Yelp Elite Event a few weeks ago and was blow away by the presentation.   Upon arrival we were greeted with two signature cocktails. I'll compared them to a margarita and sangria. Once we were seated several bottles of wine were presented to the table and the drinks just kept coming!   We started at the salad/cold bar. You'll find salads, marinated vegetables, cured meats and cheeses, and breads..it's enough you might be full after your first plate! Don't stop there...flip your "card" over to start your meat service. We tried everything cut of steak, lamb and chicken. All meats are cooked medium, but can be cooked longer by request. Don't be after to ask for what you want here. I promise they'll deliver. You can flip your "card" back and forth to start and stop the meat service again.   As if we hadn't eaten enough food, dessert was served. Eat plate contained three different cakes - cheesecake, key lime and a chocolate mousse. Needless to say we had our fill. To top of the night we each received a gift for a return visit.   I can't stress enough the exceptional service. This was by far the best Yelp event I've attended. You will not be disappointed with what Fogo has to offer.

YNgnp7eAOaq641hoTWzDrQ.text: Came here for dinner the other night and had a great experience! There were some yummy eats at the salad bar, but the highlights were definitely the selection of meats that came around. I really liked their card system (where one side is green for more and the other is red for stop). I would say I'm on the slower side when it comes to eating, so the system allowed me to pace myself and not get overwhelmed with all the food.  Tip: Fogo Restaurant Month is running from 1/21 to 3/31, where dinner is $35! Just make sure to mention it when making your reservation.

PI9L4MmISrdV_JzoWgQvxw.text: I originally came here with a yelp group and had a very good time. I came back a few months later to try it on my own and was still quite impressed. There are a few menu choices available but most people just get the same option that includes the salad bar plus all the meats. There a few good options in the salad bar, but don't fill up there. We are here for steak, not salad. The waiters come by quite regularly with different cuts of meat, chicken, pork and mostly steak. The cool part is you can try a lot of different types of cuts and see what you like the most. At one point a waiter saw we were waiting for something in particular and went into the back to get it for us. Great service and a solid drink selection too. The location is quite large, but I would still recommend getting a reservation. There is a parking lot across the street as well.

MOj_VKFumY1N_kap5WR6Kg.text: I had an amazing dinner at Fogo de chao! The cuts of meat are outstanding. The picanha is the best... The salad bar is the delicious and fresh! Service is prompt and attentive to detail, my water was never empty! Make sure to save some room for dessert, one of the best one I ever had!

BrFGrWoI9G6Oh__VV8_h_g.text: Alright so this is going to be a long review, get ready.  The short: 4.5 stars good food but with a bit too much filler for the price. Go here with friends or family it's a great meal to share!  More detailed version below:  The food: Honestly it's delicious, but it does have a few quirks. For one the lamb, their specials, and the beef ribs are by far the best portion of the meat they have a perfect mix of tenderness and flavor that makes you savor each bite, I wish I got more. Sadly I cannot say the same high praise for their chicken( literally all of it), the sirloin which is way too chewy, and surprisingly the bacon wrapped filet that was actually super dry, also the sausage is crap. Every side they gave us was great, the yuca and plantains are surprisingly sweet, the garlic mashed potatoes are a nice blend of flavors( especially if you get the peppery center), the cheese bites are just superb, creamy, sweet, cheesy, just great. The buffet is really good the cheeses, with a little meat is a great start, and to my surprise the figs, kiwi, and pineapple pair greatly with the meat. Finally, I wish I got more of the better meats they would sadly run out before they got to out table many a time.  The service: if it's you first time ask a few questions, I went there with a seasoned friend so we were pretty good but there were times where just got some much food that we couldn't eat it all so I wish in some moments they had slowed down. But, then again, in other moments they would barely come at all. That aside the staff are nice and if you specifically ask they can get you a meat of your choice.  The drinks: We just got tonic water to cut through the fat, but like they kept it filled.  The decore: It's a fancy restaurant so yea pretty nice there.  The price for what you get: I'm mixed on this one depending on how much you eat it's either way too much or actually quite little. To each their own I guess.  If you got all the way here thank you for reading, and have a nice day!

U2WJf3qrB44WCdetMW1m_g.text: Outstanding service. Seriously, I do not say this often. Great and unique drinks. If you like meat, get in here.

3D5OAHbOP1wJAVU_X80geA.text: Trued this Restaurant for Restaurant week in Pittsburgh .  We were greeted by a warm and friendly Hostess . The waitress was helpful in getting explaining the menu . The portions were generous and the food was delicious . So glad we went !

Dkxqn_d0VOR3Nxrnv1u9YQ.text: I have been to many churrascarias in the US and Brasil. This was, by far, the biggest disappointment. Service was quite poor. We had to ask for plates to be removed, glasses to be refilled, etc. Lowest quality items on salad bar I have ever seen. They push the lowest quality cuts of meat harder than I have ever seen.  For $100 per person, there is no excuse for such poor service.

Fv4k2M1-rX-zPtw2qM-V-g.text: Amazing food and even better customer service!  Everyone was extremely nice and we enjoyed the teamwork of the staff.  Our primary waiter, Justin, was amazing!  Definitely will go back next time we are in Pittsburgh.  #fogo

2zESLzm9-i_fT7-KBB_XLQ.text: First time to a Brazilian steak house and they did not disappoint.The service was attentive and the food delicious! I plan to return. Its a great place for friends or couples to enjoy.

TU55WbWDEJKkwOrbdAPnSw.text: My parents, husband and I went to Fogo on Black Friday. We have been to about 6 Fogo's across the country and the Pittsburgh location is easily one of the best if not the best! The food is always great but the real star of this store is the staff. Service is absolutely perfect. The biggest joy is that while the store has all the class and grace of its bigger locations (like Chicago), it has kept all its Pittsburgh charm. The staff is warm and inviting, as well as skilled, knowledgeable, and they clearly take great pride in what they do. Can't wait to go back!

Nkb5EwYxXU7O8YezRK0K9Q.text: This restaurant was amazing, my boyfriend and I went there few days ago and the food was incredible. Service was great and the manager helped us a lot to decide our drinks! I Highly recommend this restaurant.

BXtcq098eP6gJlIJswO45A.text: Had a delicious lunch here today. All of the food was phenomenal, but our waitress, Sage, was the best part by far. She was lovely and we had so much fun talking to her.

EAzbaAMqemwruLYIwCP0VA.text: The food was excellent. Sage, the waitress, was fantastic. She is very knowledgeable and extremely friendly.

FaZKiJRRgWrAbyhn298kkw.text: We had a wonderful lunch today. Our waitress Sage was just fantastic. Helpful and knowledgeable.

NgVU_cGWclRVfVPOfbtFng.text: Best dining experience ever! Big thanks to all the staff, as everyone was exceptional, particularly Sage and Matt ... your experts in what you do and it shows. Thanks!

WFeRUAJr1JxUbXa7omVqYQ.text: I loved this brazilian steakhouse. It was a super amazing experience. Drinks and food were out of this world.  Big thanks to Erick to make us feel welcome and to make our experience at Fogo unforgettable.

HRzKgTBUQtVhotl3Fe47_w.text: I went with my boyfriend a week ago and this was one of the best experiences I have ever had in a long time. Food was great and service was very prompt. Erick helped us to make our experience unique.

kzoTw3qfeBDJDlkGEMGMww.text: All I can say is.... WOW. 5/5 stars. I was a server at this location and must say, this was hands down my favorite group of people to work with and best environment I could have asked for. The management and staff are incredibly accommodating and friendly, as well as very hard workers who all share a great passion for providing great service and spreading Brazilian culture. I can never get enough of the unlimited options that the full experience offers, as well as the delicious drinks and complimentary bread and side dishes (the caramelized bananas are my favorite)! Also, the dessert list is off the charts as there are too many great selections to choose from. Once you flip the medallion to green, the gaucho chefs are attentive and eager to serve you all the different cuts of meat. The environment is classy, yet comfortable and I can guarantee you will never leave here still hungry. I've been to other Brazilian Steak Houses with similar concepts, however, due to the high quality and impeccable customer service, this will always be ranked #1 in my charts. This is a must see during your stay in Pittsburgh! Would highly recommend.

-PyElsAUfK0u-ZsTGG9UYA.text: A group of 4 of us went on Valentine's Day weekend.  We we promptly seated and ordered drinks. They explained that the restaurant week deal did not include all of the meats so we opted for full experience, even though the deal never specified it was for a limited menu. The salad bar was ok, nothing special there. We did not receive clean plates for our main course of the meats so after the first round we got ourselves clean plates from the salad bar. They did not clean our used salad bar plates from the table for awhile.  At the start of the meal we seemed to only have one server, but he disappeared halfway through and it seemed that no other servers really cared but would stop by every 15 minutes to ask if we needed anything, which usually we needed our drinks refilled by that time. After the first 30 minutes or so, the meats were no longer coming to our table, even though our cards were still green they would just pass us by. We had to flag down some of them to finish our meal. Also, one of the members of our party requested chicken to be brought around from multiple staff members and then finally gave up after a half hour. This is my second Fogo experience, the other was in another city and it was fine, but I will not come back to the one in downtown Pittsburgh.  Go to Green Forest or Texas de Brazil if you are looking for a good experience, I would recommend both of those.

6qtPmKj14Yvq09bEoZ3vug.text: Wow!  What an experience. Stopped by during lunch and everything from the host to the waitstaff and (of course) the food could not have been any better.  The market table offerings were fresh and delicious. The table entree options were plentiful and grilled to perfection. I passed on dessert, but they all looked fantastic as well.

-rlmb-j_ox8pWy4c_yDLqw.text: I was there on a Saturday night around 8. I had made reservations but I didn't need them. I love Brazilian but this experience was disappointing. I don't like that they do not assign waitstaff to tables-- I was told I could flag anyone down if I needed anything but there must have only been like  3 for the entire restaurant which means you can't get anything. I was unable to get a refill on my soda, and my husband was unable to order drinks. The meats were good but they only had about 6 selections. The salad table thing doesn't have much. When waitstaff finally came, I was about full, so I hastily ordered the check without the table being cleared. The table next to me had ordered their check and waited for over 20min so I knew I had to act. Overall, I don't recommend them because of subpar service and small selection. I actually recommend their competitor in station square where you get assigned waitstaff, larger selection at the salad table (they even have sushi, fish, etc), and larger selection of meats.

xtCHoNVuHW1u8siTx0D76w.text: The food is good but all 12 of us could do without the staff cutting meat and dripping grease and food on our clothes. We all had stains on our laps! They need to back up or have another system to serving the meat.

AUCJRMDZAM0JA8kR4FPkrg.text: The atmosphere is a astounding, beautiful lights and a fresh cool environment. The service is very quick and professional & they treat you like family. They're friendly and always there when you need something. The food bar is full of different delightful choices, with vegetables, meats, and cheeses. The full experience is where you get all their meats and I pick every one of them. There's nothing you could say is bad. They cook your meat how you want it and it always comes out how you like it. The managers there are always friendly and check up on you and will make you laugh. Overall, this is one of the best places in Pittsburgh and I'd highly recommend this restaurant.

GOFPQXzMFfgpL1wHdZcQwQ.text: This is the second time at this restaurant for me. Both times the food was below average and the service as well. There is no comparison between Fogo to a similar Brazilian restaurant on station square. We had gone on Monday evening when the restaurant was practically empty but there was still no one to clear the plates or fill up drinking water. We asked for fried bananas which came when we had practically finished our meal. There was dessert included in our meal but no one mentioned or asked us what was our choice. All in all a very poor experience. Don't think we'll go back.

MamMR3a-k_RcU0JOhHmB_g.text: I decided to check out this place during Pittsburgh Restaurant Week 2019. Trying to get a reservation via phone proved to be difficult and the line hung up on us twice and then were told there was no availability. We managed to secure a reservation online via OpenTable. Once we arrived a hostess did not check to see if we were waited on and checked in the guests in line behind us. Tables are a bit crowded together and this didn't allow for a more intimate dining experience. We also only received the pao de queijo (cheese bread) and did not get any crispy polenta, mashed potatoes, or caramelized bananas which were supposed to be served continuously throughout our meal.  These are the reasons I have deducted a star. Other than the initial first impression, the food and wait staff were great. I was impressed by the Market Table and Feijoada Bar, which had a diverse selection of salads and charcuterie with unlimited visit per meal. The fire roasted meat selections were high quality, well cooked and seasoned with the table side service being quick and prompt. Our waiter was very knowledgeable of the menu and made some drink suggestions based on popularity and his own personal choice. The atmosphere is upscale, but approachable, with fresh linens placed on every table prior to seating. It was overall a good experience, but I'm unsure if I would visit again unless it was a special occasion.

agBFm0Pj8BHvWbI2ioFlfA.text: Very good service and selection. The meat flavoring was a bit lackluster for our preferences.  We stopped in for our anniversary and the waiter made sure that we got a piece of cake to go since we were so full!

zcs3dwkA4yCTo0YPvC_nlg.text: This place is magical. Very unique experience where you can find something for everyone. Every single staff member is extremely friendly and engaging. Highly recommend

Vl69kEj8cTBAmawta0hRQg.text: We booked a table because of Pittsburgh restaurant week. There was a lovely selection of meats that were brought to our table as long as we had the green side up on our table tokens. They also brought complementary puffs,bananas, polenta, and garlic mashed potatoes to the table. There was also a cold bar with various vegetables and salads, as well as some hot food as well. The meat. Oh my lord. If you leave hungry there is something wrong. The restaurant week special also came with a choice of dessert. We also got talked into trying the grilled shrimp cocktail appetizer which we really enjoyed but the price on that was a little bit too steep for us. All in all, if you like meat, this is definitely the place for you. Also our server kept checking on us and we felt very well taken care of.

D3VZc7AlSTyr6hHJvPEe2Q.text: The food was delicious but our service was even better. From the hostess, to our waitress, the servers, and even the managers, every single person was personable and fun to interact with. They kept us all laughing and ensuring our service was great. It wasn't stuffy like some higher end restaurants can be. It was enjoyable and lighthearted. That alone will bring us back!

1hgadTfdfP2gGEdQyxQ4OQ.text: I am not a big meat eater, but this place was very good! I liked the marketplace with fresh salads, cheeses, and meats. It is a great accompaniment to the meal. You can order just this if you aren't much of a meat person. The meat that was carved table side was excellent and flavorful. A few fatty pieces here and there, but since you basically have an "unlimited quantity" this is not a big problem. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I also liked the sides, plantains, mashed, and the polenta (not my fave but glad I tried it). Overall enjoyed and would be back, but come hungry because there is so much food!

RmRUBec1UrT2Ztq5kNrqvw.text: Go for the Fogo experience, no question. I was not prepared for how much meat comes to the table! Everything was sooooo good! The bacon and sweet potato casserole on the market bar were my favorites too. This place was worth every penny of the $49/pp!!!

OKtbJ1jt5fYdnkieisq0FA.text: This is by far the best restaurant in downtown Pittsburgh.  The food is amazing the service was outstanding and our waitress Rebecca was incredibly helpful. Would recommend this place to anybody. If you love steak and even if you don't. They have plenty of options and the place is great. Overall very impressed and cant wait to go back.

6MBfEPbsvwSR64yLRcI07g.text: Loved it. we had a reservation at 745pm  got there at 7pm. the hostess was very nice and advised us to sit at the bar. I got a drink that was good for 15 dollars. only thing not worth the price. seated on time and the service and staff are great. Food great, location great, and the dining room was beautiful. You cant beat all you can eat Steaks, Lamb and Chicken. We will return for the great service and food.

9vkotCx-jSrVplwtV420ZQ.text: I really wanted to like this place. From the outside looking in it looked great and I heard many things about it. Before this I had never been to a Fogo establishment and expected more. The Market Table is just a fancy name for a vegetable heavy buffet. I don't eat beef or pork so I opted for the Chilean sea bass. I expected it to be a little spicy or even seasoned but instead it lacked texture and the entire plate was just sweet and one note. My friend felt the same way. I orded a d'asti Moscato that was tasty and was glad I didn't want a second one as they ran out. For there to be so many staff members on the floor the service is slow and confusing. I had a waiter come to my table at least twice offering me someone else's drinks. The garlic mashed potatoes were the star of the dish. And although very slow, the servers were polite. Will I check out this place again? Probably not! Was the ambiance nice? Yes! I just don't feel like it lived up to the hype though. It's fine dinning but they're missing some of the details here. If you happen to stumble in here though their wine list is pretty nice. Because I try to end my reviews on a good note the dessert also looked nice but I by the time I finished being frustrated by my fish, I was over the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sea Bass
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggies from the Market Table

3y5HGBE8fcfOHLjSyaaX4w.text: My boyfriend and I finally got the chance to visit Fogo de Chao last Sunday at 2pm for restaurant month.  They have a parking garage behind the building in which they validate so you won't want to forget to ask them for a ticket before you leave.  The restaurant is fairly large and you are greeted by the Market Table & Feijoada Bar (salads, meats, cheeses, vegetables, etc.) when you walk in.  We made a  reservation but the restaurant was fairly empty when we arrived.  We ordered the Restaurant Month dinner option which was $35 and included everything the full dinner includes except 4 meats.  Three of the 4 were the ribeye, filet mignon, and a lamb option.  Considering the amount  of other options there were it was OK for us.  I must say everything was delicious, my favorite was definitely the "House Cut".  Every item of this  meal was perfectly seasoned and cooked. I just wish I had a bigger stomach.  The meal also came with dessert which we were able to take home.  We got the cheesecake and chocolate mousse.  The staff were all very kind and knowledgeable.  If you have never experienced a brazilian steakhouse it is definitely worth going to.  I know we will be back.

fdGEGFtiruCzJRW4wtBlaQ.text: Fogo is a great addition to the downtown dining landscape! The atmosphere is serene and the dining room spacious. I dined with a group of 7 for lunch and we were in and out in an hour with full bellies. At $15 for lunch, the Market Table is sublime, with high-quality ingredients and a diverse mix of salad toppings. The stew was more of a generic bean concoction, but no matter - the cheesy bread, plantains and potatoes served tableside more than made up for that minor disappointment. I could've done without our server's attitude when we all ordered the Market Table instead of the Full Churrasco experience (it's lunch!), but maybe she was having a bad day - I've had one or two myself.

NG_OLluUv0KVC75-5cbSKg.text: Probably the worst service we've ever had. No one greeted us, someone just gave us bread without acknowledging we didn't have food or drinks. It took 15 minutes for us to get someone's attention to ask for water and 20 minutes later to actually get it.  It was our first time going to this steakhouse and we were VERY disappointed compared to our other Brazilian steakhouse experiences. Not only was the service horrible but the meats were very chewy and bland, which didn't make the experience any better. I would never recommend this restaurant to someone I know and will most certainly never be back.

CGzcIkesHPLhPKMrz14Onw.text: The food was phenomenal and service was 1st class.  The manager (Eddie) makes you feel right at home.  I certainly will be visiting again.

UV8htixAt_nuN4ieXkhLiQ.text: Misleading! Beware! It says on their website "Join us for Fogo Restaurant Month in Pittsburgh Monday, Jan 21-Sunday, March 31, Dinner $35 per person." It is just to get you in the door and then they slap you with a limited menu of meats. I took a party of 9 with the intention and understanding that this will be the Dinner that normally is priced at $49.95! No it wasn't! Fogo waits for you to come in to the restaurant and then disclose that it is not the same menu. No mention on the website that it is a different menu with limited meats and doesn't have the meats most people like lamb chops, leg of lamb, some prime cuts etc. I spoke to the manager Eric about it, and he explained that sure it is not disclosed on the website but here I have the limited menu I am presenting you with! He wouldn't budge to make the correction to honor the price for full experience and I was left with embarrassment to the whole party I encouraged to come and try Fogo's full experience! Will never be going again! Besides if you want to pay this much $50 go to Texas de Brazil, they have absolutely delicious meats (don't believe me try them both), sushi, more selection on the market table, Au gratin potatoes and to die for lobster soup. TDB's managers especially Michael are very personable and flexible.

JV9xxKH_k3YE2EVNgJ_M-w.text: Great Meal! The filet and Parmesan crusted pork were fabulous! Everything else was great as well the "table" had plenty of options. If I had one observation it would be I thought their cocktail menu would be a little stronger. Overall great experience!

ji5mAz7qxw8WYb9o4JNgWg.text: This is a great addition to the downtown dining scene!  We attended a networking event hosted by the Pittsburgh Business Exchange last night. (Thanks Nathan)  The restaurant owners, Larry and his wife gave us a tour of the kitchen and showed how the meat is aged and prepared. They passed samples around during the event and each one was delicious.   We are looking forward to having dinner there soon.

TA8BhGU4LeIQtbZklrY9kw.text: We were lucky to be just next to Fogo in Pittsburgh downtown. We were on a hunt for a great lunch and a few of the restaurants we were looking at were either to far or closed for the time we were looking for. So we had eaten before at other Brazilian steakhouses and enjoyed but never felt they were worth the money, but we were hungry so we went. So glad we did. This was superior to the other restaurants we had visited in the past. The quality of service and food and choices we a step above. We very much enjoyed our experience and have no regrets.

ykHnJm7f94XQZk9Sp-6aBw.text: Had an amazing Christmas lunch here. Thank you Nico, you made our day festive and the service and food was excellent!! Would definitely recommend. There was a great mix of people here for Christmas Day, so if you're traveling or looking for a fun place to spend your day, do it.

3gl_qQQEHRRoVr44zwSAmA.text: I've been here twice now; once as part of a Yelp Elite event, and once by myself for dinner. The first time Sage was part of the wait staff, and the second time I requested her as she was familiar to me from the Yelp event. Each time she was pleasant and helpful in deciphering the wine and alcohol lists, and sending over what cuts of meat I preferred (I dined at 8pm the second time; meaning that was needed for the most part as they closed at 10pm). I highly recommend requesting her as your server; she was also helpful in determining what Port as an after dinner drink was the most well rounded and similar in sweetness to the Moscato I drank with my dinner.  I can't wait to bring my family in for dinner closer t the holidays; as I think they'd enjoy it. We are definitely big meat eaters as well as wine drinkers, so this is the ideal restaurant for us!

Iii5mLrE_iZc1ZqEYh5H_A.text: Food  was fantastic! They quickly guide you through the menu excellently, and the price is well worth it. You're better off coming over here rather than spending $80 at Eat N Park. You get a better experience, a better meal, and the staff ate always friendly.

YUtFwBukqfpaiYJPl8WU8g.text: This was my favorite restaurant when I lived in Los Angeles, I'm glad they made it to Pennsylvania! Greatest quality of meats, really super fresh! The salad bar is immaculately broad. I will take my husband here on a special date night!

QX0XKJOuvwEbEJW7mwqoZQ.text: We had an issue which we were told management would contact us 4 times and never did. Better places to spend your money where they are considerate of their guests.

-Dch2m5mav565jWGM23llg.text: Update 09/2018: it gets worse! I guess we're suckers for punishment because we decided to go again. Server took our order and left as servers do. The night went as expected until we finally decided we were going to get the check. Server came over and we told her wanted the check. No problem. Came back after about 10 minutes but hubby already had the credit card out so he just handed it to her and she took it and left. We waited about 20 minutes for her and then saw her serving other people. What? So naturally we're annoyed by now and wondering where is our receipt and CARD to sign so we can leave. A few other servers came over to ask if we wanted a dessert menu but we told them we were waiting for our receipt to sign and told them who our server was. One guy came back and said they couldn't find our card. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!   Wait, there's more!  Not only did they not know where the card was, but our original server claimed SHE NEVER EVEN CAME TO OUR TABLE. Wow.   Eventually they solved the mystery of the missing credit card and comped the bill, but good grief. This place is just full of unpleasant surprises.    05/2018  Really great place for hubby to get his steak and pork fix while I took advantage of some yummy options at the salad bar. It's a typical Brazilian steakhouse set up, if your indicator is green servers come over and serve you a choice of meat. Their salad bar has a ton of options, salad, potato salad, string beans, cheese, a ton of stuff.  Only problem? So, my husband loves to chew ice and was chewing ice at the bottom of his glass w he realized one of the pieces was a piece of GLASS. Good grief. That was scary. The waiter was really apologetic but it was just really weird. I'm sure it was a one off thing but not even sure how that happens.

ZyuuHnkdBeKg_oVS7O-X4w.text: We went here for my SO's birthday dinner! He absolutely loveddddddd this place. The experience was meh though. Our waiter took forever to bring us our drinks, and then we probably sat for about 20 minutes after we were done eating before we got our bill. We weren't in a hurry though thank goodness. Overall, food was yummy though...and you can have all the meat your heart desires! It's similar in experience to Texas de Brazil, which we've also checked out.

A6Rn-LdrIZD_n90amz6PIw.text: Awesome experience... Nice spacious atmosphere. We didn't have to wait for service but were also not rushed.  The food well prepared, with lots of fresh variety to choose from.   Thanks Nico (and the team), for your professional oversight.    Truly a great visit.  We will definitely be back !!!

hL8cAUGQEgVGnnKhLrJn2g.text: I. LOVE. THIS. PLACE. it's so good!!! I'm not even a steak eater but I might need to stop saying that after eating at this restaurant. They just keep coming to you with Ute hunks of steak and it's impossible to say no and it's all delicious. Not to mention the extremely well stocked deli bar. Once you go here you'll definitely be obsessed as well.

pb3rJaOxFnBMQM_EU5Ctpg.text: Ok first thing: This is the third Brazilian restaurant I've been to like this and I have to say, this one is my least favorite. This place is a hot MESS. There are people moving around you like busy bees working yet we had awful service so what in the world were they doing?? It was not a relaxing experience. Texas de Brazil is a smaller establishment and I've never felt that way.   My friend and I went for Restaurant Week and can I tell you that the moment we mentioned that, we were treated completely differently than when we walked in. This was the same for the tables around us who also said the same. You could tell the difference in service between us and the tables who came for the regular menu. I'm sorry but that's not right. We chose your restaurant out of A LOT of other places on the list, and we should be treated no differently. So needless to say, the service was awful. We had to ask for our drinks to be filled up several times. Our original waiter never came back, but he serviced other tables near us. We had to ask for new sides. We also had to wait 20 minutes for dessert because apparently they were out of one and the person who took our dessert order never came back and told us. The long curtains for the windows were in my way the whole time and no one would help me to push them back, even though I asked. Just awful service. However, the people who brought out the meats were VERY kind and friendly. The wait staff, not so much.   The meat was nothing special. I like the meat better at Texas and Green Forrest. Also at Texas you get their full menu for Restaurant Week - not at this place. I will also say their salad bar has a lot to be desired compared to the other two places. I enjoyed the watermelon and bacon, though. That's for sure. Honestly, I can't even say a meat stood out because it all just tasted the same. The lemon pepper seasoning was too pungent and bad tasting, I sure do remember that.   One thing I can say, is that the actual room of this place is huge and really pretty/modern. It makes you feel hip and sort of like you're at this high class place even though you're stuffing yourself with all of this food.   I will not be back. I'll be visiting the other two establishments where the waitstaff is friendly and attentive and the meat is actually good.

q26ibFFG1bChG4mu8hm1_g.text: Went for lunch earlier this week.  Their salad bar is top notch, loaded with prosciutto, different salamis and cheeses, smoked salmon, olives and hearts of palm.  Our server asked how we liked our meat the first time he visited, when told rare he brought us nothing but (and it was perfect!!!) My glass never got empty before being refilled, and I don't think I went 5 minutes without a new offering. Well worth the price!!!! If I had only one thing I'd change, I'd put something a little sweet out on the salad bar to cut through all the savory flavors.

Z3szGrajgcJOpcnAp52jhQ.text: Having been a long time frequent diner of Brazilian steakhouses, I have to say this is my new favorite in Pittsburgh!!  It's a little more than Texas de Brazil, but the quality and portion sizes of the meat you get is definitely worth it.  Everything was excellent.  Our server was very friendly and attentive, and the manager stopped by a few times to ask if we needed anything as well.  Fantastic salad bar, all very high quality items.  Can't wait to go back!

-LeWSSaJdK_eqwYvZhnDqQ.text: Food: Average. Crispy Palenta and Fried Plantains were good. Mango Sea Bass lacked flavor, even with the mango sauce. Pineapple mint lemonade was delicious.  Service: Excellent. Everyone was attentive and extremely nice.  Overall: Good. If you're downtown and feeling upscale, not a bad option but not a destination.
